loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela C. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende muy amablemente en su casa de habitación ubicada en la ciudad de Masaya. Es importante destacar que ella es una dama muy alegre y con mucho ánimo de trabajar por lo que ha invertido en su negocio para mejorar su condición económica.

Hoy en día ella se ha refugiado en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito ya que su stock de inventario se le ha agotado y requiere la compra de dicha mercadería. Espera que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar con su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Maricela C. is a very hard-working woman who runs a small general store out of her home in the city of Masaya and she attends to her customers in a very friendly manner. It is important to highlight that she is a very happy person who is very excited to work because everything she invests in her business has helped to improve her economic conditions. Today she has sought out Ceprodel in order to receive a loan since she is running out of stock and she needs to buy more merchandise. She hopes to receive the loan in order to continue running her business out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tablecloths, curtains, and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Doña Leonor es integrante del Grupo el Caimito, inicio su negocio  vendiendo de manera ambulante frutas y verduras. Gracias a un financiamiento ofrecido por ADIM logró  poner una pulpería en su casa, donde ofrece productos de necesidad diaria aun con su negocio en su casa no olvida  su primer actividad que es la venta de  frutas y verduras. Cuenta con el apoyo  de su esposo y dos hijas, siendo ellas las encargadas de la pulpería. Vive  en una comarca de Nancimi llamada el Caimito. Plazo otorgado 3.5 meses
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor is a member of the Caimito Group, and started her business traveling to sell fruits and vegetables. thanks to the funding offered by ADIM, she was able to put a general store in her house, where she offers daily neceskties even though the business is in her house, she doesn't forget that her primary activity is selling fruits and vegetables. She counts on the support of her husband and her two daughters, being that they are in charge of the general store. She lives in a community in Nncimi called the Caimito. The term is three and a half months.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Digna Mercedes Gutiérrez C. tiene 36 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Decididas II, vive en la calle las Casuarinas Mz 22B  lote 7 de la Urbanización La Rinconada provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando  porque se trasladó  de ciudad y tubo que trabajar para sobrevivir.
Es madre soltera y con ella vive su único hijo por el cual lucha y trabaja con gran entusiasmo.
Empezó su negocio con una pequeña bodeguita, donde vendía tres o cuatro cosas dice, ahora su negocio a crecido y está en su propia casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas implementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en su negocio comprando artículos de primera necesidad.
Conocer junto a su hijo el Perú y el extranjero.
texts.en:
Señora Digna Mercedes Gutiérrez C. is 36-years-old and belongs to the communal bank, "Mujeres Decididas II" (Determined Women). She lives on Casuarinas street, block 22b, lot 7 of La Rinconada development in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad. She studied until her third year of secondary school and didn't continue studying because she moved from the city and had to work to survive. She is a single mother, and her only son, for whom she fights and works with great enthusiasm, lives with her. She started her business with a small grocery store, where she began selling three or four items. Now her business is growing, and it's in her own home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, she implemented her business. With this credit of 1,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in her business and purchase basic goods. She would like to travel through Peru and abroad with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (groceries)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy footwear for resale

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es: Su primera experiencia en negocio fue viajando a Costa Rica con un crédito  otorgado por ADIM  ofreciendo variedad de mercadería, de esta manera logro salir adelante e incrementar sus ventas. Lo que le ha permitido establecerse en un punto fijo en el mercado central de Rivas, donde ahora ofrece además de chinelas, calzado y variedad de ropa para adulto y niño. Doña Teodora vive en San Rafael, cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposo y  de  sus hijos, Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio más grande para darles una mejor atención  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Her first experience in business was traveling to Costa Rica with a loan obtained from ADIM offering a variety of merchandise, in this way she was able to move forward and increase her sales. What this has allowed is for her to establish herself n a stand in the central market of Rivas, where she now offers also foot wear and a variety of clothes for adults and children. Mrs. Teodora lives in San Rafael, counts on the support of her husband and her children. She dreams of arriving at having a bigger business to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: La actividad la realiza desde hace ocho años,  trabaja de lunes a domingo por la mañana, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su  mama de quien  heredo la actividad, su mayor satisfacción es llegar  a la oficina a hacer sus pagos. Con los créditos   otorgados por ADIM ha logrado  ofrecer y captar mas clientes incrementando así sus ventas. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener  un local más amplio para ofrecerles mejores condiciones a sus clientes. Doña juliana vive con su esposo y una hija,  quien se ha empeñado  en darle estudios y darle preparación  académica.
texts.en:
She has participated in this activity for 8 years, working Monday through Sunday in the morning. She counts on the unconditional support of her mother from who she has inherited the activity. Her biggest satisfaction is arriving at the point of making her bills. With the loans granted by ADIM she has been able to offer and capture more clients thus growing her sales. Her biggest dream is to arrive at having a larger space to offer better conditions to her customers. Mrs. Juliana lives with her husband and daughter, who she has started to give an education and academic preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central de Rivas,  su local es amplio accesible a los clientes donde ofrece abarrotes, golosinas cosméticos entre otros. El  negocio lo administra ella, tiene  dos dependientes, gracias al financiamiento de ADIM logro ofertar otros productos  que demanda  la población, lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas.

Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien propietario de un autobús, expresa satisfacción y agradecimiento por su mama quien la indujo a establecerse  en el mercado, administrando así su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Her business is located in the central market of Rivas, her space is ample and accessible to her customers, where she sells trinkets and cosmetics, among others. She administers the business, and has two employees, thanks to the financing of ADIM she has been able to offer other products that the population demands, which has allowed her to increase her sales. She counts on the support of her husband, who is the owner of a bus, and expresses satisfaction and thanks to her mother who encouraged her to establish herself in the market, thus running her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Casta María

texts.es: Ha logrado fortalecer su negocio con financiamientos otorgados por ADIM y a tener un mejor control de su negocio gracias a las capacitaciones. Inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa interior y chinelas. Esta ubicada en un buen punto en el mercado donde  actualmente ofrece variedad de ropa para niños, adulto y calzado  en general. Doña Casta  es madre soltera, a ella le corresponde llevar el sustento diario a su casa, tiene un hijo a quien ella lo esta motivando en los estudios para darle mejores condiciones de vida  y una carrera universitaria. Aspira ofrecer mercadería de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Ms. E. has managed to strengthen her business through funding from ADIM, and also has better control of her business thanks to their training sessions. She started out selling underwear and flip-flops. Her business is well-situated in a market in which she sells clothing for children and adults, as well as footwear. Ms. Casta E. is a single mother who must provide for her household daily. She has one son whom she is motivating in his studies so that she can give him better living conditions and provide him with higher education. She aspires to offer better quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Su principal actividad es la venta de Cosméticos, cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la actividad y una numerosa clientela, inicio  su negocio con un monto de $50.00 dólares hace cinco años con un crédito otorgado por ADIM, conforme fue creciendo su negocio fue necesitando mas financiamiento, actualmente ofrece además de sus cosméticos que son su fuerte joyas, prendas de vestir  y calzado. Doña yorleny vive en el barrio los pinos de Rivas, con su esposo y dos hijos quienes en conjunto realizan la actividad. .su  mayor deseo es poder contar siempre con financiamientos para poder inyectarle a su negocio y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Yorleny's main activity is cosmetic sales, in which she has a vast experience and a large client base. She started her business with a sum of US$50.00 five years ago, with a loan granted by ADIM. As her business grows she needs more financing. At the moment she also sells jewelry, clothes and shoes alongside cosmetics. Yorleny lives in the neighbourhood Los Pinos de Rivas with her husband and two children, who also help with her business. Her greatest wish is to always be able to count on financing to inject into her enterprise, and to have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase stock

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Gloria M. es actualmente una pequeña microempresaria la cual comenzó trabajando desempeñándose como obrera, pero posteriormente con la ayuda de su esposo y esfuerzo propio comenzó con un pequeño negocio de talabartería en donde solo realizaba trabajos pequeños como fajas, cartucheras, grabados en cueros, billeteras, etc.

Después cuando fue conociendo el mercado y con la ayuda de pequeños préstamos en Ceprodel comenzó a elaborar y comercializar artículos más grandes como monturas albardas y otros artículos que son demandados por ganaderos de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita un crédito es porque requiere invertir en la compra de los productos. Con este préstamo se beneficia tanto ella como su familia a la que quiere mucho.
texts.en:
Gloria M. is currently a small microentrepreneur who started working as a laborer. Later, with her husband’s help and her own efforts, she started a leather goods business making small items such as belts, holsters, leather engravings, wallets, etc.

Subsequently, as she got to know the market and with the help of small loans from Ceprodel, she started producing larger products such as packsaddles and other articles in demand by ranchers in the northern zone of Nicaragua. Today, the reason why she is requesting the loan is because she needs to invest in purchasing products. This loan will be of great benefit to her as well as to her family which she loves very much.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as glue, leather, and metal rings.

loans.name: Alejandrina Rosa

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 42 años de edad, estudió superior técnico, es casada y madre de 04 hijos (02 mujeres de 19 y 09 años y 02 varones de 18 y 07 años de edad). Vive en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 130, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará parlantes y audífonos para Internet. 

Alejandrina ayudaba a su madre en su tienda de abarrotes y desde los 16 años de edad se auto sostenía. A los 22 años de edad tuvo su pareja y actualmente tiene un negocio de Internet, al cual se dedica.

Su meta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y poder ampliar su Internet con más cabinas.

“El Banco Comunal es bueno porque nos enseña a ahorrar y es como un respaldo para nosotras”, manifestó doña Alejandrina.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 42 years old and studied at a technical school. She’s a married mother with 4 children: 2 females, 19 and 9 years old; 2 males, 18 and 7 years old. She lives at number 130 Jr. Cajamarca, Ilave District, El Collao, in the city of Puno and is a new associate of the Communal Bank San Miguel in Ilave.

With this loan of 500 soles ($1 US = 3 Soles, approx.), which will be repaid in 3 installments, she’ll buy speakers and earphones for Internet use.

Alejandrina helped her mother work in their grocery store and has supported herself since she was 16 years old. At 22 years of age, she found her partner and she now owns an Internet business.

Her hope is that her children become professionals and her goal is to expand her business by adding more computer stations.

“The Communal Bank is good because it teaches us how to save and serves as a support system for us”, says Alejandrina.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Internet speakers and earphones.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos. Concluyó sus estudios superiores y vive en el Jr. Bolívar Nº 127, distrito de Ilave, provincia  El Collao, Puno. 

Es socia del Banco Comunal  “San Miguel” en Ilave. En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/.300, aumentó su capital para comprar mercadería para su tienda de polleras. Hace 03 años que se inició en este negocio de alquiler de trajes y actualmente también tiene un negocio de Internet que funciona en su casa. A los 25 años de edad formó su familia y con apoyo de su esposo continuó con el negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más polleras y mantas para hacer crecer su negocio.

Su gran sueño es construir una casa para poder tener un gran hotel y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 34-year-old mother of 2 children. She finished high school and lives at number 127, Jr. Bolívar, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno. She’s an associate of the Comunal Bank San Miguel in Ilave.

At the beginning, she was given a loan of 300 soles ($1 US = 3 Soles, approx.), which she invested in merchandise for her traditional skirt store. She started her costume rental business 3 years ago and she also runs an Internet business from home.

At 25 years of age, she started a family and with the support of her husband, continued the businesses.

With this loan of 500 soles ($1 US = 3 Soles, approx.), which will be repaid in 3 installments, she’ll buy more traditional skirts and shawls to grow her business.

Her dream is to build a big house in which she can open a grand hotel in order to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy skirts and shawls.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es:
Doña Anastasia tiene 47 años D. edad, estudió tercer grado D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 02 hijos (una mujer D. 27 años con  familia y un varón D. 25 años D. edad y soltero). Vive en el Jr. Ica Nº 119, distrito D. Ilave , provincia El Collao, Puno y es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado D. Bellido” en Conduriri.

Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300, compró ropa (mantas, faldas, chompas, etc.). DesD. los 17 años D. edad vendía ropa al por mayor y menor en la ciudad D. Juliaca y a los 19 años formó su hogar y seguía con el negocio D. ropa. Actualmente, con el apoyo D. su esposo, compra y venD. carne D. alpaca a los mayoristas D. Tacna y también venD.  frutas.

Con este crédito D. S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 15 degollados D. carne D. alpaca a S/.150 cada uno, el cual será comercializado a los mayoristas D. Tacna.

Su meta es cambiar D. negocio e instalar una tienda D. gaseosas y verduras.
texts.en:
Anastasia is a 47-year-old mother of 2 children -- a 27-year-old daughter with a family and a 25-year-old son who is single. She has a graD. 3 education. She lives at number 119 Jr. Ica, in the Ilave district of El Collao province in the city of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Maria Parado D. Bellido” in Conduriri. With her initial loan of 300 soles ($1 US = 3 Soles, approx.), she invested in clothing (shawls, skirts, sweaters, etc.). At 17, she was selling clothes retail and wholesale in the city of Juliaca and at 19 she started a family and continued with her clothing business. Currently, with the support of her husband, she buys and sells alpaca meat to wholesalers in Tacna and also sells fruit. With this loan of 2,000 soles ($1 US = 3 Soles, approx.), which will be repaid in 3 installments, she’ll buy 15 alpacas at 150 soles a piece, which she will sell to wholesalers in Tacna. Her objective is to change her business; she’d like to start a store and sell soda pop and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca meat.

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
El señor Bladimir H. es un pequeño microempresario el cual se dedica a la elaboración de joyas, principalmente anillos, chapas, pulseras, cadenas pequeñas y otros encargos.

proviene de una familia la cual se ha dedicado a la joyería por lo que tienen una gran experiencia y calidad en su trabajo, en un inicio comenzó ayudando a su papá y hermanos y posteriormente se ha venido independizando aunque no cuenta con algunas herramientas propias porque son muy caras, pero en un futuro piensa tener todo el equipo de trabajo correcto

Por este motivo es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de oro y plata para llevar a cabo el trabajo y ademas para la compra de sus herramientas para mejorar su negocio de joyería. Es por esta razón que espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Bladimir H. is a microempresario who designs jewelry, mostly rings, locks, bracelets, small chains and other orders.

He comes from a family of jewelers, and as such, is skilled in making quality pieces. In the beginning, he helped his father and brothers, and then ventured off independently. Although he doesn’t own all of the equipment he needs as it’s too expensive, he hopes to in the future.

For this reason, he has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan. This money will enable him to buy the gold and silver he needs to realize his work and also buy the equipment he needs to improve his jewelry business. This is why he waits with the confidence that his loan will be granted and he can continue making a living.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold and silver in order to make jewelry.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 32 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es casada y madre de 02 hijos gemelos de 09 años de edad. Vive en el distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno y es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. 

Con su crédito inicial de S/.300, compró frutas para ser comercializado en la feria de Conduriri. Desde los 13 años de edad aprendió a vender cueros de alpaca, ovino, los cuales compraban en diferentes comunidades y vendía a los mayoristas. A los 16 años de edad formó su hogar y continua con el negocio, paralelo a ello, los días particulares se dedica a hilar lana de alpaca y vende en la ciudad de Ilave a los mayoristas que viene del país de Bolivia.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 cientos de naranja a S/.26, 02 cientos de lima a S/.30, 01 ciento de plátanos a S/.20 y con el resto de capital comprará lana de alpaca para hilar.

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y que sus hijos estudien porque no le gustaría que sean comerciantes.
texts.en:
Antonia is 32 years old, finished secondary school, is married and the mother of twin 9-year old boys. She lives in the Conduriri district in the El Collao province of Puno. She is a founding member of the communal bank “Maria Parado de Bellido” in Conduriri.

With her initial loan of 300.00 soles, she bought fruit to sell in the Conduriri market. Since she was eleven years old, she learned to sell leather from alpaca and sheep which she bought in different communities and sold to wholesalers. At 16 years of age, she formed her home and continued the business at the same time. On particular days, she dedicates herself to spinning alpaca wool to sell in the city of Ilave to the wholesalers who come to the country from Bolivia.

With this credit of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in three installments, she will buy 2 hundred oranges at 0.26 soles, 2 hundred limes at 0.30 soles, 1 hundred bananas at 0.20 soles, and with the rest of the capital will buy alpaca wool to spin.

Her goals include buying a house in the city of Ilave and that her children study because she would not like it if they became merchants.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase oranges, limes, bananas, etc.  Also, to purchase alpaca wool to spin.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine es soltera y tiene 19 años de edad. Actualmente estudia en la Universidad, vive en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 130, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, invertirá en productos de belleza marca UNIQUE, negocio al que se dedica actualmente.

Su meta es terminar su carrera profesional, ayudar a sus padres y tener una cadena de perfumería en la ciudad de Ilave, Puno y Arequipa.
texts.en:
Catherine is 19 years old and single. She is currently studying in a university. She lives in Jr. Cajamarca Nº 130, in the Ilave district of the El Collao, Puno province. She is a new member for the “San Miguel” Microfinance Institute in Ilave. She will invest this loan of 500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, in UNIQUE brand beauty products, which is what she currently sells in her business. Her goal is to finish her degree, help her parents, and have her own perfumery chain in the cities of Ilave, Puno and Arequipa.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia tiene 30 años de edad, estudió Enfermería Técnica hasta el  quinto semestre, es soltera y vive en el Jr. 3 de Mayo Nº 235, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace dos años es una de las Socias del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”. Con el préstamo inicial de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc., para  su tienda. 

Desde los 23 años de edad empezó con su negocio, su padre falleció y dejo todo a cargo de su madre, quién no pudo apoyarla a concluir sus estudios por que eran varios hermanos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará  02 sacos de arroz, 03 sacos de harina, 02 sacos de azúcar, 03 cajas de leche, 02 cajas de aceite, gaseosas, galletas, etc.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de distribución al por mayor y muchas sucursales.
texts.en:
Ms. Cecilia L. is 30 years old. She studied in a medical assistant program up to the fifth semester. She is single and lives in Jr. 3 de Mayo Nº 235, in the Ilave district of the El Collao, Puno province. She has been a member of the “San Miguel” Microfinance Institute for two years. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, she increased her capital and purchased soft drinks, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, and other goods for her general store. She started her business at age 23. Her father passed away and left her mother in charge of everything. She was unable help Cecilia complete her studies because she had many siblings. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 2 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, 3 crates of milk, 2 boxes of cooking oil, soft drinks, cookies, etc. She dreams of having many branches of a wholesale store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, flour, sugar, milk, cooking oil, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 44 años D. edad, sólo estudió el primer año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 03 hijos (02 varones D. 24 y 21 años y 01 mujer D. 18 años D. edad). Vive en el distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 4 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado D. Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300, compró verduras, negocio que se dedica en la actualidad. Doña Celia quedó huérfana D. madre al primer año D. edad y a los 3 años quedó huérfana D. padre. Creció con otras familias, no pudo estudiar porque solo se dedicaba al pastoreo y a los 20 años D. edad tuvo su pareja y empezó a vender verduras. Su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne D. alpaca, ovino, el cual lleva directamente a la ciudad D. Tacna.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 06 degollados D. carne D. alpaca a S/.900, los cuales serán comercializados en la ciudad D. Tacna, también comprará verduras a un valor D. S/.500 para ser vendidos en la feria sabatina D. Conduriri al por mayor y al por menor.

Su sueño es aumentar su capital en el negocio D. carne y que sus hijos estudien y trabajen.
texts.en:
Celia is a 44-year-old who only attended the first graD.. She is a married mother of 3 children—2 sons ages 24 and 21, and 1 daughter age 18. She lives in the Conduriri district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the “Maria Parado D. Bellido” Microfinance Institute in Conduriri for 4 years. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, she purchased vegetables, which she currently sells. Ms. Celia lost her mother when she was only a year old, then lost her father at age 3, so she was raised by other families. She was unable to study because she was a sherpedess. At 20 years old, she got married and started to sell vegetables. Her husband buys and sells mutton and alpaca meat, which he takes directly to the city of Tacna. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 6 alpaca carcasses at 900.00 PEN each, which will be sold in the city of Tacna. She will also purchase vegetables at 500.00 PEN each so that she can sell them wholesale and retail in the Saturday market in Conduriri. She dreams of increasing her capital in the meat business, and of her children studying and working.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca meat and vegetables

loans.name: De La Paz

texts.es:
D. la Paz nació el 24 D. Enero D. 1,958, estudió hasta el tercer año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 05 hijos varones D. 23, 19, 17, 14 y 09 años D. edad. Vive en la Parcialidad D. Huaripujo, distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 01 año es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Prado D. Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300 compró cueros y fibra D. alpaca. Siempre se dedica al engorD. D. alpacas, ovinos y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. 

Con este crédito D. S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar S/.300, 30 libras D. fibra D. alpaca D. primera y con S/.200.00 comprará cueros D. alpaca y ovino para ser comercializado a los mayoristas.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
D. la Paz was born on January 24, 1958. She studied up to the third graD. of primary school, is married and the mother of 5 sons who are 23, 19, 17, 14 and 9 years of age. She lives in the village of Huaripujo, in the district of Conduriri, province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "Maria Prado D. Bellido" Communal Bank in Conduriri. With her first loan for S/.300 she bought alpaca leather and wool. She has always been involved in raising alpacas and sheep and works alongsiD. her husband. With this loan for S/.500, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she has budgeted S/.300 to buy 30 pounds of top-quality alpaca wool and with S/.200 will buy alpaca and sheep leather to be sold to wholesalers. Her dream is that her sons continue studying and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy good quality alpaca wool and alpaca and sheep leather.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionisia tiene 35 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos (una mujer de 15 años y 02 varones de 12 y 04 años de edad). Vive en el Barrio San Martín, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace 05 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró fibra de alpaca, lana de ovino y cuero de alpaca. Desde hace 05 años se dedica a la compra y venta de fibra de alpaca, sale a las comunidades a comprar y vende a los mayoristas de Juliaca conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará S/.500 de fibra de alpaca según calidad y con los otros S/.500 comprará cueros de alpaca a S/.16 la libra.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave para que sus hijos estudien en dicha ciudad.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 35 years old and she finished primary school. She has a common law partner and she is the mother of 3 children (the girl is 15 years old, and the two boys are 12 and 4 years old). They live in the region of San Martin, in the district of Conduiri within the province of El Collao in Puno.

She has been a member for 5 years at the community bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri. With her first loan of S/.300 she purchased alpaca and sheep wool and alpaca hide. For the past 5 years she has been buying and selling alpaca wool, going to communities to purchase and sell to wholesalers in Juliaca together with her husband.

With this loan of S/.1000, which will be repaid in 3 terms, she will purchase S/.500 worth of alpaca wool, depending on quality, and with the remaining S/.500 she will purchase alpaca hide at S/.16 per pound.

Her dream is to purche a house in the city of Ilave so that her children can attend school in that city./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca wool, depending on quality, and alpaca hide.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió hasta el quinto año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 09 hijos D. los cuales 02 son menores D. edad. Vive en el Jr Tacna Nº 456, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

En un inicio con el préstamo D. S/. 300 compró gelatina, galletas y bolsas D. caramelos. Nos cuenta que desD. muy joven se dedica a la venta D. gelatina en el mercado D. Ilave y a los 14 años D. edad tuvo su primer hijo por lo que no  pudo continuar sus estudios, entonces se dedicó a la venta D. gelatina y golosinas.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 10 bolsas D. gelatina, 05 cajas D. leche, 01 un saco D. azúcar, etc.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando hasta que sus 02 hijos menores sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dominga is 57 years old and she went to school up to graD. 5. She is married and she is the mother of 9 children, of whom only 2 are still minors. She lives in Jr Tacna Nº 456, in the district of D. Ilave, within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a founding member of the community bank "San Miguel" in Ilave.

She started with a loan amounting to S/.300 and with the funds she purchased gelatins, cookies, and bags of caramels. She says that since she was a young girl she has been selling gelatins in the markets of Illave, and when she was 14 years old she had her first son. she could not keep going to school so she decided to start selling gelatins and sweets.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1000 (repaid in a term of 3 months), she will purchase 10 bags of gelatin, 5 boxes of milk, and 1 sack of sugar, etc.

Her greatest dream is to be able to keep working until her two youngest children become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of gelatin, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila tiene 64 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. siete hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Sólo estudió hasta el tercer año D. primaria, vive en el Jr. 3 D. Mayo Nº 235, distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El  Collao, Puno, y es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/.300, incrementó su capital para comprar  cereales, chuño, papa, quinua, etc. Manifiesta que no estudió porque sus padres decían que las mujeres no podían estudiar, que debían dedicarse a las labores D. la casa. A los 20 años D. edad tuvo familia y continúo con su negocio D. cereales, los cuales vendía en la Feria D. Ilave. Su esposo falleció y la dejó sola a cargo D. sus hijos por lo que continúo vendiendo sus productos y se propuso sacarlos adelante. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará más cereales como 5 quintales D. papa, 5 arrobas D. chuño, quinua, etc.

Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Domitila is 64 years old, a widow, and the mother of 7 children, all of whom are now adults. She only studied until the third graD.. She lives on May 3rd St., No. 235, in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, city of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. With her first loan of 300 soles ($100), she increased her capital to buy grains, potato flour, potatoes, quinoa, etc. She says she did not study more because her parents told her that women couldn’t study and that they should dedicate themselves to housework. When she was 20 years old, she had her first child and continued with her grain business, which she sold in the Ilave Market. Her husband passed away and left her alone to take care of her children. She continued selling her products and decided to keep moving forward with her children. With this loan of 3000 soles ($975), which she will repay in 6 payments, she will buy more grains: such as 500 kg of potatoes, 70 kg of potato flour, quinoa, etc. Her dream is that her children will have a better future and that they will be successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains, potatoes, flour, quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 40 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es casada y es madre de 02 hijos varones de 16 y 08 años de edad. Vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 1288, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno y es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita” en Yunguyo. 

Desde los 15 años de edad empezó con el negocio de frutas, caramelos, los cuales vendía en la feria de Huacullani. A los 24 años de edad tuvo su pareja y ambos empezaron a trabajar y poner su tienda de abarrotes, el cual hasta la fecha sigue con ese negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 cuotas, comprará productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes) y gaseosas, 02 bolsas de Azúcar con S/.150, dos bolsas de arroz con S/.270, tres bolsas de fideos con S/.900 y gaseosas de diferentes precios con S/.500.

Su meta es hacer estudiar a sus hijos y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old and studied up to the fifth year of secondary school. She is a married mother of 2 boys, ages 16 and 8. She lives in Jr. Arica Nº 1288, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puna. She is one of the founding members of the “La Yunguyeñita” Microfinance Institute in Yunguyo.

Ever since the age of 15, she started her own business selling fruit and candy at the Huacullani market. At age 24, she got married and she and her husband opened up their own general store, which they are running up until now.

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase basic need items, soft drinks, 2 sacks of sugar with 150.00 PEN, two sacks of rice with 270.00 PEN, three sacks of noodles with 900.00 PEN, and soft drinks with 500.00 PEN.

Her goal is to make her children study so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need items (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.) and soft drinks

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena es casada, tiene 66 años D. edad, estudio sólo el primer año D. primaria, es madre D. 4 hijos ya mayores (tienen familia), vive en el Jr. Apurimac N: 328, distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao- Puno, y es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

En un inicio con el préstamo D. S/. 300, compró una arroba D. coca que vendía en el mercado D. Ilave, al mismo tiempo se dedicaba a la crianza D. animales menores como porcinos. No pudo continuar sus estudios porque sus padres no la apoyaban.

Actualmente tiene una tienda D. abarrotes dedicándose también, conjuntamente con su esposo, a la elaboración D. pan. Viaja a diferentes lugares como López y Chipana para vender coca y reparte pan por las tardes en el mercado. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará más insumos para su panadería como 05 sacos D. harina, 05 sacos D. arroz, etc.

Su mayor sueño es aumentar su negocio y que su panadería crezca.
texts.en:
Elena is married, she is 66 years old, and she went to school only until graD. 1. She is mother of 4 children, all are now adults and have families. She lives in Jr. Apurimac No. 328, in the district of Ilave within the province of El Collao - Puno.

In the beginning with a loan amounting to S/.300, she purchased a load of cocoa that she later resold in the markets of Ilave. At the same time she also raised small animals, like piglets. She couldn't keep going to school because her parents did not support her.

Currently she runs a convenience store but she also bakes bread with the help of her husband. She travels to different places such as Lopez and Chipana where she can sell her cocoa and she also distributes her breads in the afternoons at the market.

With this loan, amounting to S/.2000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase more ingredients for her bakery, including, 5 sacks of flour, 5 sacks of rice, etc.

Her greatest dream is to increase her business and to see her bakery grow.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the bakery, such as flour and rice etc.

loans.name: Emperatriz Lorenza

texts.es:
Doña Emperatriz es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria y es madre de 03 hijas (2 hijas mayores y una de ellas aún es menor de edad). Vive en el Jr. Apurimac Nº 156, distrito de Ilave, provincia  El  Collao, Puno, y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó a su capital y compró golosinas, papel higiénico, etc. Nos cuenta que para salir adelante vendía chicha en el mercado de Ilave. A los 41 años de edad comenzó con este negocio sola y sin ayuda de su esposo.

Desde que integró el Banco Comunal empezó con el negocio de Vinos y  continúa con la venta de chicha.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 300 litros de vino a S/. 35 cada uno, envases de vidrio, etc.

“Es excelente el apoyo que brindan ya que otros bancos piden muchos requisitos” manifestó  Emperatriz.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijas sean profesionales y trabajen pronto.
texts.en:
Emperatriz, 51, is married. She completed five years of high school and is the mother of 3 daughters (2 grown and one younger). She lives in the Peruvian "provincia" of El Collao, Puno and belongs to the San Miguel community bank in Ilave.

With an initial loan of S/.300 [300 Peruvian soles], she increased her working capital and bought candy, toilet paper, etc. She tells us that she used to sell "chicha" [a maize-based liquor] in the market at Ilave as a way to get ahead. At 41, she began this business on her own, without any help from her husband.

After joining the community bank, she started a wine business. She also continues to sell chicha. With this S/.500 loan, to be repaid in 3 installments she will buy 300 litres of wine at S/.35 each, bottles, etc.

Emperatriz says, "The help that they provide is excellent because other banks have a lot of requirements". Her greatest hope is that her daughters become professionals and find work soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wine and bottles for wine business.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia tiene 45 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y madre de 04 hijos (03 varones de 26, 13 y 4 años y 01 mujer de 24 años de edad). Vive en la Parcialidad de San José, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri desde hace 03 años. 

Desde los 12 años de edad vendía fruta en la ciudad de Ilave, Conduriri, a los 19 años de edad tuvo su pareja y desde entonces se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras a la fecha.

Con el préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 sacos de zanahoria con S/.120, un ciento de repollo con S/.60, dos de tomate con S/.40 y con el saldo comprará cebolla, apio, poro, etc.

Su meta es cambiar de negocio, dedicarse a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, ovino al por mayor y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Eudosia is 45 years old, studied through primary school, is married, and has 4 children (3 males who are 26, 13, and 4, and one female who is 24). She lives in the area of San José, the district of Conduriri, the province of El Collao, in Puno. She has been a member of the communal bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduriri for 3 years.

When she was 12, she started selling fruit in the city of Ilave in Conduriri. At 19 she got married and since then she has sold vegetables. With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of carrots for 120 nuevos soles, 100 cabbages for 60 nuevos soles, and 2 sacks of tomatoes with 40 nuevos soles. With the balance she will buy onions, celery, leeks, etc.

Her goal is to change her business and to buy and sell alpaca and sheep meat wholesale and to support her children so they can get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, celery, leeks, etc.

loans.name: Eva Yaneth

texts.es:
Eva tiene 25 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es casada y madre de 02 hijos (una mujer de 05 años y un varón de 01 año de edad). Vive en el Jr. Manco Capac interior 29, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y desde el año pasado integra el Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” en Ilave.

Con su primer préstamo de S/.300, compró 01 televisor con S/.280.00 de segunda mano. A los 22 años de edad formó su hogar y desde esa fecha hasta hoy se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos usados. Su pedido le llega cada quincena o cada mes, y su esposo le ayuda en el negocio porque es técnico.

Con este crédito de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará un equipo de sonido con S/.700, el cual será comercializado en la feria de Ilave.

Su meta es construir su casa propia en la ciudad de Ilave, además que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

 “Desde que integro el Banco Comunal he aprendido a ser más responsable y puntual y ello es muy bueno”, manifestó doña Eva.
texts.en:
Eva is 25-years-old, studied through her fifth year of secondary school, is married, and has 2 children (one girl who is 5 and one boy who is 1). She lives at Jr. Manco Capac interior 29 in the district of Ilave, the province of El Collao, in Puno. She has belonged to the communal bank, "La Ilaveñita" in Ilave since last year.

With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought one second-hand television for 280 nuevos soles. When she was 22, she formed her family, and since then she has bought and sold used devices. She receives her order every two weeks or every month. Her husband helps her with her business because he is a repairman. With this credit of 800 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase a stereo for 700 nuevos soles, which she will sell at the market in Ilave.

Her goal is to build her own house in the city of Ilave and to educate her children so they can be professionals. "Since I became a part of the communal bank, I have learned to be more responsible and punctual, and that is very good," says Doña Eva.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase a stereo

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia tiene 43 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos (una mujer de 20 años y un varón de 09 años de edad). Vive en el Barrio Municipal, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y desde el año 2005 integra el Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. 

Desde los 15 años de edad aprendió a vender golosinas y pan, a los 20 años tuvo su pareja y ambos juntaron capital e instalaron su tienda de abarrotes que a hasta la fecha lo atienden.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará dos bolsas de arroz con S/.260, una  bolsa de azúcar con S/.80, tres bolsas de harina con S/.350 y cinco bolsas de fideos con S/.90 para vender al por menor.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio con la venta de frutas y verduras, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Felicia is 43 years old, studied through elementary school, and is a wife and mother of two children (a woman age 20 and a boy 9 years old). She lives in the Municipal neighborhood, in the district of Conduriri, province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the “Maria Parado de Bellido” communal bank in Conduriri since 2005. When she was 15 years old, she learned how to sell sweets and bread, and at age 20 she married. She and her husband worked together to gather capital and started their grocery store, which to this day they still run. With this loan of 1000 soles ($325), which she will repay over 3 months, she will buy two bags of rice for 260 soles ($85), a bag of sugar for 80 soles ($26), three bags of flour for 350 soles ($113), and five bags of noodles for 90 soles ($29), which she will sell in her retail store. Her dream is to expand her business with the addition of fruits and vegetables, and that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, flour, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 37 años de edad, estudió quinto de Secundaria, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 10 años de edad. Vive en la Av. Circunvalación Nº 152 , distrito de Ilave, provincia de El  Collao, Puno, y es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” en Ilave.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró más mercadería. A los 15 años de edad empezó a vender ropa en el mercado, no pudo continuar sus estudios superiores porque a los 18 años de edad tuvo a su hijo lo que le impulso a trabajar más. Actualmente continua con este negocio y tiene una tienda de ropa en el Jr. José Gálvez. Tuvo que salir delante sola sin apoyo del Padre de su hijo.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más mercadería como casacas, pantalones, juegos de ropa para niñas y niños, ropa deportiva, etc..

Su mayor deseo es que su negocio crezca y pueda tener dos o más tiendas de ropa.
texts.en:
Filomena is 37 years old and she completed grade 11. She is a single mother and she has a son aged 10 years. They live at Av. Circunvalacion No. 152 in the district of Ilave in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a member of the community bank "La Ilavenita" in Ilave.

She started otu with a loan in the amount of S/.300, with which she increased her working capital and purchase more merchandise. At the aged of 15 years she started selling clothing in the markets. She couldn't keep going to school because at the age of 18 y ears she had her son and this gave her the push to work even harder. Currently she keeps the same business, having a clothign store in Jr. Jose Galvez. She had to work alone because she did not receive any support from her son's father.

With this loan, amounting to S/.2000, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase more merchandise, including shirts, slacks, and clothing for boys and girls, sports outfits, etc..

Her greatest dream is to see her business expand and to have two or more clothing stores.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, clothing for boys and girls, sports outfits etc.

loans.name: Gladys Dina

texts.es:
Gladys cumplió 21 años de edad, estudió Enfermería Técnica, es soltera y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad. Vive en el distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 3 cuotas, comprará carne de alpaca de 04 degollados a S/.120.00 cada uno, el cual venderá a los mayoristas que vienen de la ciudad de Tacna.

Su meta es trabajar como Enfermera Técnica y seguir estudiando para ser profesional en Enfermería y apoyar a su hija hasta que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Gladys is 21 years old, studies vocational nursing, is single and has a 4 year old daughter. She lives in Conduriri District, El Collao province in Puno and is a new member of the Maria Parado de Bellido community bank in Conduriri. With this loan of 500 Soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she will buy the meat of 4 alpacas, costing 120 Soles each, which she will sell to the wholesalers that come from the city of Tacna. Her dream is to work as a vocational nurse and to continue studying to become a registered nurse and support her daughter so that she can also become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca meat to sell

loans.name: Georgina Marisela

texts.es: La señora Georgina habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 37  años, se encuentra casada con  el señor Iván Perez que es ingeniero civil, juntos tienen  3  hijos, los cuales están estudiando. La señora Georgina se dedica a la venta de nacatamales que inicio este negocio con las ventas de sopas hace 2 años, ella aspira mejorar su casa donde habita  mas de 9 años, por tanto solicita un crédito de C$  8,000 a un plazo 10 meses para comprar material de construcción y ponerle cielo raso a su casa; así mismo poder en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de estructura de su cocina,  ya que le gustaría ampliarla para invertir mas en la elaboración de nacatamales y de esta forma tener mas ingresos para apoyar mas a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Georgina lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood located in the capital city of Managua. She is 37 years old and is married to Mr. Iván Perez, who is a civil engineer. They have 3 school age children. Ms. Georgina sells nacatamales—Central American tamales—for a living. She started this business via soup sales 2 years ago. She aspires to repair her house of residence, where she has been living for more than 9 years. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $8,000.00 Nicaraguan córdobas, which will be repaid in 10 monthly installments, so that she can build a ceiling for her house. She would also like to improve her kitchen structure in the future because she wants to expand it and invest more in the preparation of nacatamales, thus increasing her income so that she can further support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for ceiling

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de dos niños menores de edad. Concluyó sus estudios superiores, vive el Jr: Loreto Nº 335 del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia  El Collao – Puno y desde hace 5 años es socias del Banco Comunal de  “San Miguel” en Ilave.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 incrementó a su capital para comprar insumos para su restaurante como verduras, arroz, azúcar, gas, papa, etc. Después de dos años decidió cambiar de negocio y abrió un SNACK BAR, en el cual vende tortas, salteñas y empanadas. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda de venta de celulares y continúa con el negocio del Snack Bar. Nos cuenta  que por falta de trabajo se dedica a este negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.3000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 05 sacos de harina, 07 sacos de arroz, etc. y más accesorios para su tienda de Celulares.

Su mayor sueño es tener una quinta con restaurante y varias tiendas de venta de celulares.
texts.en:
Gloria is 33 years old, and has a domestic partner and 2 under age children. She finished her studies and lives in Jr. Loreto Nº 335 in the Ilave district, in the Province of El Collao – Puno. She has been a member of the San Miguel microfinance institute for 5 years. In the beginning, she increased her capital with a loan of 300.00 PEN in order to buy supplies such as vegetables, rice, sugar, propane, potatoes, and others for her restaurant. After two years she decided to change her business, so she opened up a snack bar in which she sells cakes, salteñas (savory pastries filled with pork, beef, or chicken mixed with a sweet and spicy sauce), and empanadas. She currently owns a cellular phone shop as well as her snack bar business. She tells us that she runs both businesses due to a lack of employment. With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 5 sacks of flour, 7 sacks of rice, among other goods, as well as more cellular phone accessories for her shop. Her biggest wish is to own a country house with a restaurant and have several cellular phone shops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice and cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 40 años D. edad, estudió sexto grado D. primaria, es casada y  madre D. dos hijos varones. Vive en el Jr Zepita Nº 203, distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El  Collao, Puno, y es socia del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” desD. hace 04 años.

En un inicio, con el préstamo D. S/.300 compró ropa para vender en el mercado. DesD. muy niña trabajaba como empleada D. hogar porque no tenia padres, y para salir adelante cambió D. negocio y se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando bordados en bayeta y tejiendo miniaturas que venD. en el mismo distrito D. Ilave.

Con este crédito D. S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 30 metros D. bayeta y 3 kilos D. lana D. diferentes colores.

Su sueño es vender sus productos fuera del país y seguir bordando sus bayetas y tejiendo mas miniaturas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 40-year-old married mother of two sons. She completed the sixth graD. and lives in the Jr Zepita Nº 203, in the Ilave district of the El Collao, Puno district. She has been a member of the “La Ilaveñita” microfinance institute for 4 years. With her initial loan of 300.00 PEN, she purchased clothing in order to sell it in the market. At a very young age, she started working as a domestic servant because she did not have parents. In order to get ahead in life, she changed her business and now embroiders hand-crafted, woolen cloths, as well as knits miniatures that she sells in the district of Ilave. With this loan of 300.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 30 meters of woolen cloth and 3 kg of wool in assorted colors. She dreams of continuing to embroider her cloths and knit her miniatures, and of selling her products outsiD. her country.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth and wool in assorted colors

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Doña Irene tiene 56 años D. edad, estudió quinto año D. primaria, es casada, madre D. 08 hijos (04 mayores y 04 menores D. edad) y vive en el Jr. Bolognesi  Nº 129, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 08 años es socia del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita” en Ilave. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300 compró golosinas: galletas, chocolates y caramelos. Por falta D. medios económicos no pudo estudiar porque sus padres eran muy pobres y además eran varios hermanos. A los 18 Años D. edad tuvo su pareja y desD. los 20 años puso un restaurante, negocio al que se dedicó por varios años. DesD. hace 10 años venD. golosinas que trae D. la ciudad D. Tacna y venD. en Ilave. En la actualidad en paralelo a la venta D. golosinas, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes.

Con este crédito D. S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar con S/. 800, 20 cajas D. chocolate D. diferentes precios, con S/.600, 10 cajas D. aconcagua y S/.300 D. dulces. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos menores sean profesionales y también continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is 56 years old. She studied through the 5th year of elementary school. She is married and has 8 children, 4 are young 4 are old. Irene lives at 129 Jr. Bolognesi in the district of Ilave in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of "La Ilaveñita" Community Bank for 8 years. WIth her first loan of 300 soles, she purchases sweets, including cookies, chocolate and candy. Due to the lack of economic means, Irene could not study because her parents were very poor and she had many siblings. At age 18, she met her husband, and since age 20 she has owned a restaurant. 10 years ago she began selling sweets, which she brings from the city of Tacna and sells in Ilave. Currently, along with selling sweets, Irene operates a grocery store. With this loan of 2,500 soles, which will be repaid in 3 months, she plans to purchase 800 soles worth of chocolate (20 boxes at different prices), 600 soles worth of canned food and 300 soles worth of sweets. Irene's dream is that her younger children become professionals and that she is able to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase, chocolate, sweets and canned-food.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
Jacoba tiene 24 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de 02 hijos (una mujer de 05 años y un varón de 02 años de edad) y vive en el segundo sector Buenavista del Centro Poblado de Chacachaca, distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chuchito, Puno.

Desde hace 05 años integra el Banco Comunal “Buenavista” en Chacachaca. Con su primer crédito de S/.300, compró 02 ovinos a S/.800.00 cada uno. Desde que integró el Banco Comunal empezó el negocio de compra y venta de engorde de ovinos y porcinos, los cuales compra en las ferias de Huapaca, Yunguyo y lo vende en Acora. Actualmente sigue con su negocio y ahora incrementó el capital y compró ganado vacuno.

Con este crédito de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 vacas a S/.1,000 cada uno para engorde.

Su sueño es tener un establo de ganado vacuno con sus respectivos cobertizos y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jacoba is 24 years old and she went to school up to grade 11. She is married common-law and she is the mother of 2 children (a 5-year old girl and a 2-year old boy). She lives in the second sector of Buenavista of Centro Poblado in Chacachaca, in Pomata in the province of Chuchito in Puno.

For the past 5 years she has been a member of the community bank "Buenavista" in Chacachaca. With her first loan of S/.300, she purchased two head of cattle for S/.800 each one. Since she became a member fo the community bank she has been running her business of buying and selling of head of cattle and pork. She purchases them in the fairs of Huapaca in Yunguyo and she sells them in Acora. She is still running the business and she has managed to increase her capital and purchase another head of cattle.

With this loan, amounting to S/.2000 and which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 2 cows to fatten at S/.1000 each.

Her dream is to have a stable for her cows and for her children to study and to become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa tiene 49 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada  y madre D. 04 hijos (dos con familia dos solteros). Vive en el distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado D. Bellido” en Conduriri.

Con su crédito inicial compró productos D. primera necesidad (abarrotes). Quedó huérfana D. padre a los 06 meses D. nacida, sólo su madre la apoyó. A los 18 años D. edad empezó a vender frutas y pan en Conduriri. A los 21 años se casó y junto con su  esposo acumularon capital e instalaron una tienda D. abarrotes que hasta la fecha continúa con dicho negocio. También tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. carne D. alpaca y fibra D. alpaca, compran D. la comunidad D. Circapampa y venden a los mayoristas D. Tacna.

Con este crédito D. S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 05 degollados D. carne D. alpaca a S/.130 cada uno y con el resto comprará fibra D. alpaca dependiendo D. la calidad y color.

Su meta es comprar más alpacas y ovinos para engorD., y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Josefa is 49 years old and she completed primary school. She is married and she has 4 children (two are still with the family and 2 are single adults). She lives in the district of Conduiri in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a founding member of the community bank "Maria Parado D. Bellido" in Conduiri.

With her first loan she purchase items of primary need (groceries). Her father passed away when she was only 6 months old, leaving only her mother for support. At the age of 18 she started selling fruit and breads in Conduiri. At the age of 21 she got married and together with her husband they accumulated enough capital funds to set up a convenience store, the same store that she still runs today. She also has a business buying and selling alpaca meats and alpaca wool. She purchases them in Circapampa and sells to wholesales in Tacna.

With this loan amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 5 alpaca at S/.130 each and with the rest she will purchase alpaca wool priced according to the quality and color.

Her goal is to purchase more alpacas and pork, and to support her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meats and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 56 años D. edad, no tiene estudios, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos (dos varones y dos mujeres, todos con familia). Vive en la Parcialidad D. Phorque, distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Pardo D. Bellido” en Conduriri.

En un inicio obtuvo el crédito D. S/.300, con el que compró cuero y fibra D. alpaca D. primera calidad para hilar y vender a los intermediarios D. Conduriri. DesD. niña se dedica al engorD. D. alpacas, llamas y ovinos. En la actualidad, paralelo a su hilado, se dedica a vender carne D. alpaca que entrega a los mayoristas en Ilave y Conduriri D. 02 a 04 degollados semanalmente.

Con este crédito D. S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 alpacas con S/.240, 10 libras D. fibra D. alpaca con S/.100 y con el saldo comprará cueros D. alpaca y D. ovino.  

Su sueño es criar alpacas mejoradas.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old and she never attended school. She is married and has 4 children (two sons and two daugthters, all of whom have their own family). She lives in Parcialidad D. Phorque in the district of Conduiri, within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Maria Pardo D. Bellido" in Conduiri.

At the start she obtained a loan in the amount of S/.300 with which she purchased leather and high quality alpaca wool to spin into yarn for producers in Conduiri. Since she was a girl she has been raising alpacas, llamas and pork. Currently, in parallel to yarn production, she sells alpaca meat to wholesales in llave and Conduiri, usually from 2 to 4 heads of livestock weekly.

With this loan, amounting to S/.500 which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 2 alpacas at S/.240 each and 10 pounds of wool with S/.100. With her earnings she will purchase alpaca leather.

Her dream is to be able to raise more alpacas, yielding better quality.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 alpacas, alpaca woold and leather.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El señor Silverio habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 55  años, se encuentra casado con la señora Andrea Valle, quien es ama de casa, juntos tienen 6 hijos dos varones y 4 mujeres, quienes trabajan. Actualmente el señor Silverio se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y productos  lácteos, actividad que la inicio con la ayuda de un hermano hace 16 años, el desea un crédito de C$  4,000 a 6 meses, para la comprar mas inventario de granos básicos y lácteos para aumentar sus ventas, ya que también aspira poder hacer que su negocio crezca y de esta forma mejorar su nivel de vida poco a poco.
texts.en:
Silverio lives in the Reconciliación Village neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. He is 55 years old, married to Andrea Valle who is a housewife. Together they have 6 children, 2 sons and 4 daughters, all of whom work. Today Silverio sells basic grains and dairy products, a business he began with the help of his brother 16 years ago. He wishes for a loan of C$4,000 which will be repaid in 6 months to buy more inventory of basic grains and dairy products to increase his sales. He also aspires to be able to make his business grow and in this way improve his standard of living little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and dairy products

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: La señora Patrocinia V. en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 47  años,  se encuentra casada con el señor Sergio quien es taxista, junto tienen 5 hijos. Actualmente la señora Patrocinia se dedica a la costura, teniendo su taller de costura en su casa, quien inicio este negocio con la venta de un taxi hace 5 años, ella esta solicitando un crédito de C$  6,000 a 9 meses para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que necesita reparar una maquina de coser y para comprar  tela y poder realizar mas ropa, por tanto ella aspira en un futuro poder ir comprando poco a poco maquinas industriales que le permitan trabajar sin dificultad y hacer ropa de mas calidad; para a la vez incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patrocinia V. lives in the Reconciliación Village neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is 47 years old, married to Sergio who is a taxi driver, and together they have 5 children. Today Patrocinia is a seamstress; she has a sewing shop in her home. She began this business 5 years ago by selling a taxi. She is asking for a loan for C$6,000, which will be repaid in 9 months, to invest in her business as she needs to repair a sewing machine and buy fabric in order to make more clothing. She aspires in the future to be able to buy, little by little, industrial sewing machines that will enable her to work without difficulty and make better quality clothing in order to increase her sales and obtain greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and buy fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Pablo Alvino

texts.es: El señor Pablo en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 47  años, se encuentra casado con la señora Maria Bustillo, juntos tienen dos hijos de 15 y 23 años de edad, donde uno de ellos estudia y el otro hijo trabaja. Actualmente el señor Pablo es albañil y es pensionado, desde hace 40 años que se dedica a la albañilería, así mismo desea mejorar su casa, por tanto solicita un crédito de  C$  4,000 a 9 meses, para mejorar el cuarto de su hija; también desea seguir mejorando las actividad de albañilería  y poder ganar mejor para ir mejorando las condiciones de  su casa y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo lives in Reconciliación Village neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. He is 47 years old, married to Mrs. Maria Bustillo. Together they have two children ages 15 and 23, one of who studies and the other works. Today Pablo is a bricklayer and retired. For 40 years he has worked in masonry. He now wants to improve his home, so he is asking for a loan for C$4,000, which will be repaid in 9 months, to improve his daughter’s room. He also wishes to continue improving his masonry work and be able to earn more income to improve the condition of his home and quality of life of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material and improve his daughter's room

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Luis Guillermo habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene a  cargo  a su sobrino de 16 años. Actualmente el señor Luis se desempeña como operador   de control y calidad en la Coca Cola, donde tiene 18 años de trabajar en la empresa, el aspira en un futuro ir mejorando poco a poco su casa; así mismo ayudar a su  hermana para juntos crear una pequeña pulpería, el esta necesitando un crédito de C$   15, 000 a 12  meses para poder  comprar  materiales de construcción ya que desea construir las paredes de la sala y cuarto de su casa, por tanto el señor Luis aspira seguir esforzando para ir mejorando las condiciones de vida y ayudar a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Guillermo lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. He is 46 years old and is responsible for a 16 year old nephew. Today Luis works as a control and quality operator for Coca Cola. He has worked in this business for 18 years and aspires in the future to improve his home little by little. He is also helping his sister and working to open a small convenience store. He needs a loan for C$15,000, which will be repaid in 12 months, to be able to buy construction materials as he wishes to construct the walls of his living room and room of his home. Luis aspires to continue strengthening himself to improve his living conditions and help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room and living room on his home.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: El señor Donald habita  en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 36 años, se encuentra casado con la señora Rosa Elieth  Rodriguez, tiene la edad de 30 años, quien le ayuda a los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica a  la venta de ropa y cosméticos, juntos tiene  3 hijos. Actualmente el señor Donald se desempeña como guardia de seguridad de la alcaldía de Managua, en los tiempos libre cultiva frijoles, maíz y trigo, tiene 16 años de trabajar para la alcaldía, el aspira darle buenas condiciones  de vida a su familia y por tanto solicita un crédito de C$  14,000  a 9 meses para mejorar el piso de su casa, así mismo en un futuro desea fortalecer sus tierras para obtener mayor producción y  poder comercializar maíz, trigo y frijoles.
texts.en:
Mr. Donald lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, which is located in the capital city of Managua. He is 36 years old and is married to Rosa Elieth Rodriguez, who is 30 years old and helps him with the household expenses by selling clothing and cosmetics. Together, they have 3 children. Mr. Donald is currently employed as a security guard at the mayor’s office of Managua. In his free time, he also grows beans, corn and wheat. He has been working for the mayor’s office for 16 years. He aspires to give his family better living conditions, which is why he is requesting a loan of C$ 14,000.00, which will be repaid in 9 months, so that he can improve the flooring in his house. In the future, he would also like to strengthen his crop fields so that he can yield more produce and sell corn, wheat and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair house floor

loans.name: Ericka De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Ericka habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 34 años, se encuentra casada con el señor Martín de Jesús Palacios, el cual es taxista y le ayuda a los gastos de la casa, juntos tienen 3 hijos de 7, 8 y 9 años de edad quienes están estudiando. Actualmente la señora Ericka se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada donde empezó esta actividad con dinero que su esposo le proporcionó para que iniciara su negocio; hace 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella esta solicitando un crédito de C$  7,000 a un plazo de 9 meses para comprar material de construcción y poner verjas y ladrillo  en su casa, donde aspira seguir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda, y también seguir creciendo con su negocio para que le permita tener una  estabilidad económica buena.
texts.en:
Ericka lives in the Sandino Memorial neighborhood, a neighborhood located in the capital city, Managua. She is 34 years old, married to Mr. Martín de Jesús Palacios, who is a taxi driver and helps her with the household expenses. Together they have 3 children ages 7, 8, and 9 who are all in school. Today Ericka sells new and used clothing. She began this business with money her husband gave her to start her business, and she has had this business for 6 years. She is asking for a loan of C$7,000 for a term of 9 months to buy construction materials and put wrought iron railings and brick on her home, where she hopes to continue improving little by little her home, and also continue growing her business which will enable her to have good economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put wrought iron railings and brick on her home

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina habita en el barrio Waspan Sur, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 50 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, tiene una hija de 35 años quien le apoya en la venta de comida. Actualmente la señora Rosa Argentina tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende comida casera, lo inicio con un préstamo que ella realizo en una y con el apoyo de su hija, esforzándose ambas en el negocio, ya  que comenzaron con pocos clientes, por tanto la señora rosa argentina solicita C$ 10,000 aun  plazo de 12 meses para capital de trabajo comprar mas materia prima y poder ofertas mas variedad de comidas y por tanto incrementar sus ingresos de ventas;  y lograr en un futuro desea hacer mas grande su negocio  y lograr estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina lives in the South Waspan neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is 50 years old, single, and has a 35 year old daughter who support her in her business selling food. Today Rosa Argentina has a small business where she sells homemade food. She began this business with a small loan she made with the help of her daughter, both of them growing stronger through the business, as they began with few customers. Now Rosa Argentina is asking for a loan of C$10,000, which will be repaid in 12 months, to buy more raw ingredients and be able to offer a greater variety of food and thereby increase her income from sales. In the future she wishes to make her business bigger and achieve economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients to invest in her business selling homemade food

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: La señora Argentina habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 46 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, solamente vive con sus hijos de 20 y 25 años quienes trabajan. Actualmente la señora Argentina tiene un carretón de caballos donde realizar acarreos,  donde dio inicio a esta actividad hace 6 años con un préstamo que hizo y así pudo comprar su primer caballo para ponerlo a trabajar, por tanto solicita nuevamente otro crédito de C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 7 meses para adquirir otro caballo y tener dos carretones trabajando, ya que de esta forma le permitirá obtener mas ingresos y poder en un futuro comprar una camioneta para hacer acarreos mas largos y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Argentina V. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, located in the capital city of Managua. She is 46 years old and single. She lives with her children, who are 20 and 25 years old and who work. Ms. Argentina currently has a horse-drawn cart with which she transports goods. She started her business 6 years ago with a loan that she took out, which was how she was able to purchase her first horse to put it to work. Hence, she is once again requesting a loan of C$ 7,000.00 Nicaraguan córdobas, to be repaid in 7 monthly installments, so that she can purchase another horse and have two horse-drawn carts working. Thus, she can obtain more income and in the future be able to purchase a truck to make longer trips so that she can keep supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse

loans.name: Maria De Jesus
