Her partner, Pablo, works with her in this business, and agrees with her the decisions she proposes to improve on and prosper from their labor. They sell, on average, between 350 and 450 blocks of ice per day. Even still, this does not provide them with sufficient income to satisfy all of their needs. Since the ice machines are very expensive she needs a loan to purchase another ice machine and increase her sales. Support Maria, she is a hard worker and will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and additional ice machine.

loans.name: Jhon Wingler

texts.es:
Wingler, como muchos le conocen, tiene 20 años, soltero, es un joven emprendedor y empeñoso, aporta con los gastos familiares, ya que como hijo mayor, representa el papel de padre y tiene que sacar adelante a su hermanito de 10 años edad. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace varios años atrás, y ya es propietario de un motocarro.  
Su deseo, tiene que ver con su madre, solicita el préstamo para construir al costado de su vivienda un local para la venta de comida, que estará a cargo su mamá, la señora Norma, quien se siente orgullosa de su hijo. Para Wingler, no existe nada imposible, ya que hará todo lo posible para lograr su objetivo. Además, parte del dinero obtenido, lo usará también, en la compra de repuestos para el arreglo de su motocarro. Con tu apoyo, lograremos cumplir el propósito de este joven en un tiempo muy breve.
texts.en:
Wingler, as many know, is 20 years old, single, and a young, hard working entrepreneur. He helps out with the household costs, and since he is the oldest child, plays the part of father and must succeed for his younger, 10 year old brother. He has worked as a passenger transport for several years now, and owns an auto. He desires, on behalf of his mother, a loan to construct an area to sell food in the back of their home. The store would be in the charge of his mother, Norma, who is very proud of her son. For Wingler, nothing is impossible, since he will do everything possible to achieve his goals. In addition, Wingler will aslo use part of the loan obtained to purchase the parts needed to repair his auto. With your support, we will accomplish the goal of the young man in a very short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his auto, an construct a location in their home for his mother to sell pepared food.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, de 46 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos maravillosos y súper cariñosos, junto a su esposa Gloria, quién siempre lo apoya en todo, tienen la finalidad de educar, amar y apoyar a sus hijos en lo bueno y lo malo. William implementó un negocio de venta de abarrotes, hace varios años atrás, y su objetivo diario es de dar una buena atención a sus clientes, la fidelidad es estos, hacen que él siga adelante con todos sus propósitos. Desde siempre, William ha aspirado con ser mayoritario en la venta de abarrotes, sin embargo, para la realización de eso, necesita de un capital, el cual lo invertirá en estos gastos. Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
William is 46 years old, father of 3 marvelous and super loving children. Together with his wife Gloria, who always supports him in everything, they strive to educate, love and support their children through the best and the worst. William started his business selling general goods several years ago. His daily goal is to provide the best attention to his clients, whose loyalty he relies on to help him accomplish all of his goals. As always, William aspires to be the best in general store sales. Nevertheless, to achieve this, he needs a loan that he will invest in supplies. We support this strong and dedicated father who continues to work very hard.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increas quantity of products in his general store so that he can provide the best  service.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, a sus 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos, muestra ser una mujer  decidida y capaz de salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) inicia este negocio, a razón de que su vivienda está en un lugar muy transitado. Todo marcha bien en su negocio, pero le falta acondicionar el espacio para la atención a sus clientes, ya que los atiende dentro o fuera de su vivienda. Su razón de salir adelante es por la mejora de su economía y calidad de vida, además de solventar los gastos de  sus hijos, quienes deben seguir estudiando y lograr ser profesionales. Solicita este préstamo para acondicionar un espacio para la atención de sus clientes, y una mejor comodidad para el desempeño de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gloria, at 38 years of age, is mother of 4 children. She has shown herself to be a very strong woman capable of making it through. Her occupation is the sale of drinks (beers and soft drinks). She started this business because her home is located in a well travelled area. All is going well with her business, but she needs to renovate the space to give better service to her clients, serving them within and just outside her home. Her reason to keep going is for the sake of improving her financial situation and her quality of life. She also needs to cover her childrens' expenses. They must continue to attend school and become professionals. She requests this loan to remodel her space to give better service to her clients, and to make her job easier to manage.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the space to better serve her clients.

loans.name: Sigile  Jiggene Group

texts.fr: LE groupe  SIGILE JIGGENE regroupe des femmes mariées mere de plusieurs enfants travallant dans le secteur du commerce .Elles vendent des produits variés allant des fruits et legumes aux tissus en passant par les jus de fruit  et les glaces.Depuis plus de 10ans elles enpruntent des credit s qu 'elles se partagent et chacune  d' elle finance son petit commerce.Les remboursements des credits se font pendant les reunions  mensuelles du groupe qui se tiennent tous les 5 du mois.Le montant du pret obtenu permettra à chacune d 'elle de renforcer son activité et d'accroitre ainsi ses revenus pour l'entretien du menage.
texts.en:
The Sigile Jiggene group consists of married women, mothers of several children, who work selling goods. They sell various products from fruit and vegetables to cloth and fruit juice and ice. For more than 10 years, they have been taking out loans that they share, each of them investing in her little business. The repayments take place during group meetings that are held on the 5th of every month. Each of them is able, thanks to her share of the loan, to bolster her business and thus increase her earnings for household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y con su último hijo. Hace 12 años inició en su negocio en su propia casa, se trata de una tienda donde ofrece productos principales de alimentación, comenzó con poco capital y en la actualidad ve los frutos de su ardua labor, a pesar de que las ventas han bajado por esta época del año, trabaja incesantemente porque se acercan las fechas festivas donde tiene mayores ganancias, de ahí que la atención que ofrece en su tienda es diaria y seguirá esforzándose en ello. Su deseo es disfrutar la vida cada día y de ayudar a su último hijo que está estudiando en la universidad. Angélica solicita este préstamo con el que podrá invertir en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor, y así obtener mayores ganancias en su tienda.
texts.en:
Angelica is 56 years old and lives with her husband and her youngest son. Twelve years ago she started her business in her home. It is a store where she sell basic food products. She started with little capital and is now seeing the results of her hard work. In spite of her sales having gone down due to the time of year, she works incessantly because of the upcoming holidays when her income is higher. She offers daily attention in her store and will continue to do so. Her wish is to enjoy every day and help her son who is studying at the university. Angelica is requesting this loan which she will be able to invest in the purchase of groceries at wholesale, this way improving the profits in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of footwear and underwear for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of various goods and ingredients to produce fried dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more toilet products and other goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to keep producing empanadas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start selling clothing accessories

loans.name: Badegna (Parenté) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe badegna est un regroupement de sept femmes du village de kimparana qui ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Toutes mariées elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec des coépouses et autres parents dans la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république Mali).
Unis par des liens professionnel et de voisinage les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le groupe est à son quatrième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de fruits et légumes (bananes, papayes, oranges, mangues, ananas, melon, carotte, aubergine, épices etc.) à partir de la préfecture de Sikasso auprès des producteurs locaux.
Ces femmes vendent leurs produits au marché de kimparana, de porte en porte et souvent au bord de l’artère principale traversant la ville, à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, régler les frais scolaires et les dépenses familiales.  Dans les jours à venir elles ambitionnent devenir des producteurs de fruits et légumes en se lançant dans les plantations et le jardinage.
texts.en:
Badegna is a group of seven women from the village of Kimparana who average 38 years of age and five children. They are all married and live in traditional extended families with co-wives and other parents in San Prefecture (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by ties of profession and community, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. The group is on its fourth solidarity loan (group loan). Each of the preceding loans has been correctly repaid.

They intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables (bananas, papayas, oranges, mangoes, pineapples, melons, carrots, eggplants, spices, etc.) in Sikasso Prefecture, from local producers.

These women sell their goods at the Kimparana marketplace, door-to-door, and often on the side of the main artery crossing the city. They sell to customers composed of a complete cross-section of society.

With this new loan, they intend to realize an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA per cycle that will be used to repay the loan interest and to cover school fees and family expenses. In the days to come, they have the ambition of becoming producers of fruits and vegetables by launching into plantings and gardening.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace varios años  atrás, sus ganas de seguir adelante en este negocio son motivadas por sus hijos, que son estudiantes y tienen muchas ganas de seguir adelante en sus estudios. Hermelinda quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales, por lo que su conviviente Edvin siempre la apoya en todo y sobre en la educación de su hijos. A sus 33 años tiene el deseo de prosperidad, implementar su negocio y ambientarlo, para brindar una mejor acogida y buena impresión, es por ello que requiere de un capital para llegar a concretar su propósito.
texts.en:
Hermelinda's occupation is the sales of drinks (beers and soft drinks) and she has been doing so for many years. Her will to keep her business going is motivated by her children, all of whom attend school and are very keen on keeping up their studies. Hermelinda wishes to see her children as professionals. Her common law partner Edvin always supports her in everything, especially on the education of their children. She is 33 years old and she dreams of prosperity, and she wishes to remodel her working space to provide a better ambiance and give a better impression. For this she requires a loan, a working capital to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and to improve the business space.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 22 años de edad, estudió cuarto grado de primaria, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos (un varón de 08 años y una mujer de 02 años de edad). Vive en la Parcialidad de Phorque, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. 

Al primer año de edad quedó huérfana de padre y madre, sólo sus abuelos maternos la criaron. A los 19 años tuvo su pareja y desde entonces se dedica a hilar fibra de alpaca.

Con este crédito de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 25 libras de fibra de alpaca de primera calidad para hilar y vender a los mayoristas de Ilave.

Su meta es ser Microempresaria de Artesanía en tejidos y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Julia is 22 years old and she has a grade four education. She is common-law married and she has two children ( a son aged 8 years and a daughter aged 2). She lives in Parcialidad de Phorque in the district of Conduiri within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a new member of the community bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri.

She became an orphan at the age of one, with only her grandparents to take care of her. At the age of 19 she became married and shince then she has been dedicating her time to making alpaca yarn.

With this loan, amounting to S/.300 which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase 25 pounds of high quality alpaca wool to spin into yarn and to sell to wholesalers in Ilave.

Her goal is to be an artisan and a small business owner and to support her children so that they can go to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality alpaca wool.

loans.name: Neiser

texts.es: Neiser, de 36  años, es padre de un hijo, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, los cuales le ayudan a fortalecer la economía de su hogar, junto a Ana, su conviviente, quien se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, trabajan y se esfuerzan para solventar los estudios de su hijo. Neiser desea reparar uno de sus motocarros, ya que el vehículo se encuentra en mal estado, para ello requiere de una cantidad de dinero, para comprar repuestos y algunas piezas que harán que su herramienta de trabajo funcione de la mejor manera, además de esto, quiere dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, tener una bodega en su casa. Apoyemos a este padre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante, con tu ayuda el podrá cumplir su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Neiser is 36 years old and he is the father of one boy. His occupation is passenger transportation, something he has been doing for many years. He is currently the owner of two motorcycles and they help him stabilize the household finances. Together with Ana, his common law partner who sells prepared foods in the evenings, they both work hard to send their son to school. Neiser needs to repair one of his motorcycles, it is in a bad state of disrepair. For this he requires a sum of money, to purchase spare parts and some tools. Aside from this, he also runs a convenience store and he runs that from their home. Let us support this father that has shown such great will to become a success. With your help he will be able to meet his goal in a very short time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elith

texts.es: Elith, de 47 años, es madre de tres hijos que están fuera del hogar y son independientes, gracias a la educación  y las buenas costumbres que ella las impartió. Vive con su esposo Jaime, que se dedica a trabajar como vendedor ambulante, y la apoya mucho.  Elith se dedica a la venta de diversos productos plásticos y para el hogar (baldes, mata moscas, escobas, etc) y también vende abarrotes, todo esto para contribuir con los gastos familiares, debido al carisma con el que cuenta y a la concurrencia  de sus clientes, se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, es por eso que necesariamente requiere de una cantidad de dinero para lograr su meta trazada. Con tu apoyo, Elith logrará lo que quiere en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Elith is 47 years old and she is the mother of three children, they have all moved out and are independent, all thanks to the education and to the good upbringing she gave them. She lives with her husband Jaime. His occupation is selling door to doo and he supports her a great deal. Elith works at selling various plastic products and items for the home (buckets, fly swatters, brooms, etc.) and she also runs a convenience store. She does all of this to contribute towards the family expenses. Thanks to her charisma and to returning clients, she sees the need to expand her business. Necessarily she requires a sum of money to achieve her goals. With your support Elith will be able to get what she needs in no time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and improve her business, and to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, a sus 40 años, es madre de dos hijos maravillosos, espera de ellos, es que estudien y sean profesionales algún día. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica, desde hace mucho tiempo, a la venta de productos de personales (hilos, papel higiénico, productos de limpieza, telas, entre otras variedades). También vende de comida por las noches y gracias a su carisma y jovialidad se ha ganado una gran gama de clientes, es por eso que ahora optó por comprar un mostrador (vitrina) y llenarla con sus productos. Es madre soltera, y dice, no necesitar, ni depender de nadie, para salir adelante. Precisa de un capital para lograr su objetivo y cumplir lo que quiere. Con tu ayuda Maria logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and she is the mother of two wonderful children. She expects them to study and grow up to be professionals one day. She is a very active woman with dreams of self-improvement. She has been selling since a long time household products (threads, bathroom tissue, cleaning products, fabrics, among other items). She also sells prepared foods in the evenings and thanks to her charisma and joviality she has earned herself a great client base. She has now decided to purchase a display case for all of her products. She is a single mother, and she says, she dreams of not needing to or having to depend on anyone to make it through. She requires capital funds to meet her goals and to accomplish what she wants. With your help Maria will be able to achieve her goals in a very short time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case to organize her products.

loans.name: Djamadjigui (L’Espoir Des Hommes) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe djamadjigui est un regroupement de huit femmes du   village de kimparana (Préfecture de San Région de Ségou) qui sont des voisines. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Les prêts précédents ont permis de consolider les activités et d’augmenter et de fidéliser la clientèle.  Elles mènent différentes activités (la restauration, la vente de légumes, de fruits et de condiments alimentaires.). Les membres du groupe avec leur expérience ont une grande capacité d’adaptation aux réalités du marché. Ainsi elles changent la nature de leur activité selon les opportunités et les besoins de la clientèle. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter divers produits et les revendre au marché de kimparana et dans les villages voisins.
Elles s’approvisionnent à partir des localités voisines de Sikasso et de San auprès de grossistes attitrés. En raison de l’écoulement rapide des produits, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 120 000 CFA. de bénéfice pendant la durée du prêt. Une grande partie du bénéfice sera utilisé pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djamadjigui is a group of eight women of the village of Kimparana (San Prefecture, Ségou Region) who are neighbors. They average 36 years of age, are married, and are mothers of at least six children.

To expand their business, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. The preceding loans enable them to consolidate their work and to have more customers and gain their loyalty. They do different work (catering and selling fruit, vegetables, and condiments). The group members, with their experience, have a great capacity to adapt to market realities. And so they change the nature of their business according to the opportunities and customers needs. The current loan will be used to buy different goods and resell them at the Kimpara marketplace and in neighboring villages. They get their supplies from the neighboring towns of Sikasso and San from accredited wholesalers.

Because of the rapid turnover of goods, they intend to realize an average profit of 120,000 francs CFA over the duration of the loan. A large portion of the profits will be used to address typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different articles

loans.name: Bethsabe

texts.es: Bethsabe tiene 38 años, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, que son  sus consentidos y la luz que la guía a seguir surgiendo en su negocio. Se separo del padre de sus hijos hace mucho tiempo, ahora vive junto a su madre, quien la apoya y quiere mucho, ambas se dedican a la venta de comida. Bethsabe es cada día motivada por el amor a sus pequeños, a quienes quiere darles lo necesario para que sigan adelante. Menciona que sola se encuentra mejor, sobre todo porque tiene en qué ocuparse, su negocio. Ahora quiere construir un kiosco o ampliar su pequeño espacio de comida, incluso mejorar la infraestructura, sin embargo para la realización de todo esto, necesita de un capital, que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Apoyemos a esta madre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante, sin la ayuda de aquel hombre desinteresado e irresponsable.
texts.en:
Bethsabe is 38 years old, a single mother of three children, which she indulges as they are the light that guides her in her goal of continuing in her business. She separated from the father of her children a long time ago and now lives with her mother, who supports her and loves her very much. They both work at selling food. Bethsabe is motivated daily by the love for her little one, for who she wants to provide with what they need to continue to prosper. She noted that she is better off alone, especially since she has her business. Now she wants to build a stand or expand her small space where she sells the food, including improving the infrastructure. However she needs capital in order to accomplish all this, which she is requesting in the form of a loan. Let us support this mother that wants to keep moving ahead, without the help of that disinterested and irresponsible man.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To establish her business and have a stand built from which she can sell food.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es soltera, tiene 22 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, vive en el Barrio José Carlos Mariategui, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao,  Puno, y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

A los 19 años de edad empezó a realizar negocios, se dedica a dos actividades, los días sábados vende ropa (llicllas, casacas, mandiles, etc.) y los demás días vende golosinas en la plaza de Conduriri.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 3 cuotas, comprará con S/.65 cinco paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes precios, con S/.50 seis bolsas de dulces, con S/.100 cinco cajas de galletas y con el saldo comprará, chicitos y otros.

Su meta es aumentar su capital y tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucila is single, she is 22 years old and she studied up to grade 11. She lives in Barrio Jose Carlos Mariategui, in the district of Conduiri within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a new member of the Community Bank "Paria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri.

At the age of 19 she started her business. She carries on two businesses: on Saturdays she sells clothing (scarves, jackets, aprons etc.) and the other days she sells snacks at the plaza in Conduiri.

With this loan of S/.500, a loan which will be repaid in 3 months, she will purchase 5 cases of soft drinks for S/.65, six bags of candies for S/.50, and five boxes of cookies for S/.100. With her earnings she will purchase cheese chips and other items.

Her goal is to increase her capital to have greater earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr: Mr N. est agé de 35ans ,il est marié et pére de 3 enfants.Il habite la ville de Mbour où il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants.Il exerce le métier de commerçant de vétements depuis 5 ans.Les objets qu' il vend sont les pantalons des chemises et autres vétements pour hommes.Avec le montant du pret obtenu  il renforcera son stock de marchandise en vu des rentrées scolaires periode pendant laquelle les ventes sont importantes.
texts.en:
Mr. N., 35, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in the town of Mbour with his wife and his children. He has been working selling clothing for 5 years. He sells pants, shirts, and other clothing for men. With the loan, he will expand his inventory with a view to the back-to-school period during which there are lots of sales to be made.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Magda Juana

texts.es:
Magda es natural del distrito de Macusani, provincia de Carabaya, Puno, nació el 06 de Mayo de 1977, estudió segundo grado de primaria, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad (dos mujeres de 8 y 6 años  y un varón de 07 meses de edad). Vive en el distrito de Conduriri, Provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal de “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

Con este crédito de S/.300, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas comprará 05 paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes marcas con S/.70, 06 cajas de galletas con S/.150.00 y 04 bolsas de chupetines con S/.40.00, los cuales serán comercializados diariamente en la plaza de Conduriri. Paralelo a este negocio ella se dedica ha tejer, es socia de “Artesanía nuevo Amanecer”, convenio con el Corredor Puno – Cuzco. Desde hace dos años les llega pedidos de la ciudades de Cuzco y Lima.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Magda is originally from the District of Macusani in the province of Carabaya in Puno. She was born on May 6, 1997 and she went to school up to grade 2. She is married common law and she has 3 children who are still minors (two are girls, aged 8 and 6 years, and the boy is 7 months old). She currently lives in the District of Conduiri in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a new member of the Community Bank "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri.

With this loan amounting to S/.300, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 5 cases of soft drinks of different brands for S/.70, 6 cases of cookies for S/.150, and 4 bags of candy suckers for S/.40. The products will be sold daily at the plaza in Conduiri. In parallel to this business she also spends her time knitting. She is a member of the gruop "Artesania Nuevo Amanecer" in Corredor Puno in Cuzco. For the past 2 year she has been taking orders in the city of Cuzco and Lima.

Her dream is to purchase a house in the city of Ilave, and for her children to go to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, cookies, and candy.

loans.name: Mariaelena

texts.es:
Marielena tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos. Estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, vive en el Jr. Manco Capac  Nº 438 del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 500 Nuevos Soles, pudo comprar detergentes, papel higiénico, pasta dental, etc. Nos cuenta que no continúo sus estudios  por que quedo embarazada. A los 22 años de edad decidió cambiar de negocio y actualmente se dedica a criar animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, pollos), los cuales vende los días Domingos en la Plaza Dominical con ayuda de su esposo.

Con este préstamo  de S/. 900,  el cual será cancelado en 3 cuotas, comprará forraje el cual le costara S/. 200 cada uno y comida para alimentar a sus animales.

“En el Banco Comunal me apoyaron bastante y así pude aumentar mi capital y hacer crecer mi negocio”.

Su anhelado sueño es tener una Granja de Cuyes de Raza y abrirse mercado en el Cusco para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marielena is 27 years old, she is married common law and she is the mother of 2 children. She went to school up to grade 11. She lives in Jr. Manco Capac No. 438 in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a member of the community bank "San Miguel" in Ilave.

In the beginning, with a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles, she was able to purchase detergents, bathroom tissue, toothpaste etc. She says that she couldn't keep going to school because she became pregnant. At the age of 22 she decided to change her business, one that she still carries out, and that is raising small livestock (guinea pigs, hens, chicken). She sells these on Sundays in the Plaza Dominical with the help of her husband.

With this loan amounting to S/.900, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase fresh feed for S/.200 each and other feed for her animals.

"The community bank supported me a great deal, permitting me to increase my capital to expand my business."

Her greatest dream is to have a Guinea pig farm and to find herself clientele in Cuzco to improve her standard of living.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 34 años de edad, estudió superior Tecnológico, es casada y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad cuyas esdad son de 14, 06 y 02 años de edad. Vive en el Jr. Arequipa Nº 387, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y desde hace 08 años es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes). A los 20 años de edad tuvo su pareja y desde entonces se dedica a la venta y compra de productos (abarrotes). En la actualidad, mayormente vende los días domingos en la ciudad de Ilave.

Con este crédito de S/.900, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 bolsas de arroz con S/.270, 02 bolsas de azúcar con S/.50, 05 bolsas de fideos con S/.135, 01 balde de aceite nacional con S/.112., para ser comercializado al por menor.

Su sueño es tener una casa en la ciudad de Ilave, que sus hijas estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
With her first loan of S/.300, she purchased basic needs products (groceries). At the aged of 20 she got married and since then she has dedicated her time to the purchase and sales of grocery products. Currently she mostly sells on Sundays in the city of Ilave.

With this loan, amounting to S/.900 and which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of rices costing S/.270, 2 sacks of sugar costing S/.50, 5 bags of dry pasta costing S/.135, 1 pail of cooking oil costing S/.112. These products will be sold retail.

Her dream is to have a house in the city of Ilave, and that her daughters attend school and grow up to be professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 27 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es casada, madre de dos hijos (una mujer de 05 años y un varón de 02 años de edad) y vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 1053, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Desde el año 2001 es integrante del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita” en Yunguyo. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300, empezó el negocio de compra y venta de baldes de caucho, los cuales traía de Arequipa y vendía por docenas en Yunguyo. A los 18 años de edad vendía casacas en la ciudad de Juliaca y a los 20 años tuvo su pareja. Actualmente vende verduras y polleras de bayeta.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 cuotas comprará polleras de bayeta por un monto de S/.700 (a un costo de S/.22 a S/.70 cada pollera) y con S/.300. comprará verduras para vender al por menor.

Su meta es poner una tienda de ferretería en la ciudad de Yunguyo y apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old and she completed high school. She is married and she is mother of 2 children (a girl aged 5 years and a boy aged 2). She lives in Jr. Arica No.1035 in the district and province of Yunguyo in Puno.

Since the year 2001 she has been a member of the Community Bank "La Yunguyenita" in Yunguyo. With her first loan of S/.300, she started the business of buying and selling natural rubber, buying in Arequipa and selling by the dozen in Yunguyo. At the age of 18 she started selling jackets in the city of Juliaca and at the age of 20 she married. Currently she's selling vegetables and ladies' clothing.,/p>

With the loan of S/.1000 which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase ladies' clothing for S/.700 (each costing from S/.22 to S/.70) and with S/.300 she will purchase vegetables to resell retail.

Her goal is to set up a hardware store in the city of Yunguyo so that she can support her children to go to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ladies' clothing and to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: Mr  Birane N. est un jeune  commerçant agé de 43ans ,il marié et pere de famille. IL habite la ville de Mbour .son activité principale est la vente d'objets d'art (des masques des statuettes des tableaux  d'art) dans les cites touristiques de Mbour.Avec le montant du pret il va préparer l'ouverture de la saison touristique  en renforçant  et diversifiant les produits pour attirer plus de clients  et vendre d' avantage.
texts.en:
Mr. Birane N. is a young merchant, 43 years old, married, and a father with a family. He lives in the city of Mbour. His main work involves selling art objects (masks, statuettes, paintings) in tourist areas of Mbour. With this loan, he is going to prepare for the opening of tourist season by boosting and diversifying his products to attract more customers and to make more sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es conviviente, madre de un hijo varón de 4 años de edad y vive en el Barrio 25 de diciembre del distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno. 

Por falta de capital decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. A los 23 años de edad tuvo su pareja y a los 25 años empezó con el negocio de ropa (chompas, mandiles, faldas, etc.), vendía en Conduriri, también se dedica a la compra y venta  de carne de alpaca y ovino, compra en Conduriri y vende en la ciudad de Tacna. Semanalmente lleva de 10 a12 degollados, y desde hace 02 meses se dedica al negocio de combustible.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 03 degollados a S/.120.00  y a S/.150.00 cada uno, dependiendo del peso y calidad.

Su meta es aumentar capital a su nuevo negocio y hacer estudiar a su hijo. “Desde que integra el Banco Comunal he aprendido a caminar a la hora” manifestó  Nancy.
.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old and she completed high school. She is married common law and she is the mother of a little 4-year old boy. She lives in the area called 25 de diciembre (meaning December 25) in the District of Conduiri in the province of El Collao in Puno.

Given the lack of capital she decided to become a member of the Community Baqnk "Maria Parado de Bellido" in Conduiri. At the age of 23 she got married and at the age of 25 she started her business selling clothing (jackets, aprons, skirts, etc.), selling her products in Conduiri. She also buys and sells alpaca and beef meats. She purchases in Conduiri and she sells in the city of Tacna. On a weekly basis she takes 10 to 12 animals, and since about 2 months ago she got into the fuel business.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1000 and which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 3 animals at S/.120 and S/.150 each one, depending on their quality and weight.

Her goal is to increase the capital for her new job so that her son can go to school. Nancy said " Since I became a member of the Community Bank I have learned to be a success."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 animals.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 40 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es madre de 05 hijos (dos mujeres y dos varones), vive en el Jr. Atahualpa Nº  607, del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia  El Collao – Puno y es una de las socias del Banco Comunal  “San Miguel”

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500 aumentó su capital y compró más cosméticos para incrementar su negocio, al mismo tiempo se dedica a alquilar su cochera para la guardianía de vehículos, específicamente se guardan triciclos, carretas, etc. No continuó sus estudios porque decidió formar su familia.

Con este crédito de S/.800.00, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más cosméticos, los cuales venderá en instituciones como el Hospital.

“Gracias al crédito del Banco Comunal obtuve más ganancias e incrementé mi negocio” manifiesto Nancy muy alegremente.

Su mayor deseo es crecer en su negocio y vender en las demás instituciones, tanto Públicas y Privadas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, studied to the fifth year of secondary school, is the mother of 5 children (two daughters and two sons), lives in Jr. Atahualpa Nº 607, of the Ilave District, El Collao Province – Puno and is one of the members of the San Miguel Communal Bank. With the first loan of S/. 500 she increased her working capital and purchased more cosmetics to grow her business. At the same time she works renting her garage to keep vehicles, specially tricycles, carts, etc. She did not continue her studies because she decided to form her family. With this loan of S/.800.00, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy more cosmetics which she will sell in institutions such as the hospital. “Thanks to the loan from the Communal Bank I obtained more earnings and grew my business” expressed Nancy very happily. Her greatest wish it to grow her business and sell in other institutions, both public and private ones.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida tiene 33 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores, es conviviente, madre de  una hija, vive en el Jr. Pasco Nº 107 del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Puno y es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave

Con el préstamo que obtuvo de S/. 300 compró productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes) para su tienda, posteriormente cambió al negocio de compra y venta de motocicletas junto con su esposo.

Actualmente se dedica a la artesanía y también continúa con el negocio de Motocicletas. Adicional a ello realiza trabajos de bordados y estampados en banderines, bandas, etc.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, lo invertirá en comprar material para elaborar guantes, chalinas, gorros y miniaturas para exportar al extranjero.

“Los créditos que brindan nos favorecen ya que en otra entidades financieras nos piden garantía y aquí nuestra palabra vale mas”.

Su sueño es independizarse y tener más contactos para exportar su mercadería al extranjero.
texts.en:
Nelida is 33 years old, finished high school, is married, is mother of a daughter, lives in Jr. Pasco Nº 107 of the Ilave district, province of El Collao, Puno and is a founding member of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. With the loan obtained of S/. 300 she bought essential household products (groceries) for her store. Later she changed her business to the purchase and sale of motorcycles with her husband. Currently she works with crafts and she also continues with the motorcycle business. In addition to that she does embroidery and stamp projects in banners, etc. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be paid off in 3 installments, will be invested to purchase material to make gloves, shawls, hats and miniatures to export abroad. “The loans that you provide favor us more as in other financial entities that ask for collateral and her word is worth more”. Her dream is to become independent and have more contacts to be able to export her merchandise abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest it in the purchase of material to make gloves, shawls, hats, etc.

loans.name: Nieves Carmen

texts.es:
Nieves tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 02 hijas, concluyó sus estudios superiores y actualmente trabaja en el Sector Educación. Vive en el Jr. 3 de Mayo Nº 125 del distrito de Ilave, provincia  El Collao, Puno y es una de las socias fundadoras  del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital comprando gaseosas y también gelatina para poder preparar y distribuir en diferentes lugares como colegios, mercados. Al mismo tiempo se dedicaba a comprar fibra de alpaca. A los 30 años de edad siguió con su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos (todos trabajan en la preparación de gelatina).

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 100 paquetes de gaseosas más bolsas de gelatina y fibra de alpaca.

“Me parece muy bien los créditos que brindan, porque así incrementamos nuestro capital” manifestó doña Nieves.

Su sueño es convertir su casa en una quinta restaurante para que sus hijas salgan profesionales.
texts.en:
Nieves is 40 years old, married, the mother of 2 children, concluded high school and currently works in the education sector. She lives in Jr. 3 de Mayo Nº 125 of the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno and is one of the founding members of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. In the beginning, with a loan of S/. 300, she increased her working capital buying soft drinks and also gelatin to be able to make it and distribute it in different places like high school, markets. At the same time she worked buying alpaca fiber. At 30 years of age she continued with her business with her husband’s support and that of her children (all work in the preparation of gelatin). With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 3 installments, I will buy 100 packets of soft drinks, more gelatin bags and alpaca fiber. “I think that the loan they provide a good because they increase our working capital” expressed Nieves. Her dream is to convert her house into a restaurant complex so that her children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, bags of gelatin and alpaca fiber.

loans.name: Pilar Karina

texts.es:
Pilar tiene 20 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es conviviente, es madre de un niño pequeño de 02 años de edad y vive en el Jr. Atahualpa L-A5, distrito de Ilave, provincia  El  Collao, Puno.

Desde hace dos años es socia del Banco Comunal “La  Ilaveñita” en Ilave. En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, compró ropa, la cual vendía en el mercado. Posteriormente cambió de negocio y decidió trabajar con la venta de abarrotes. A los 18 años de edad tuvo familia y no pudo continuar sus estudios superiores. Actualmente se dedica a su negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comparará 05 sacos de arroz, 04 de azúcar, 07 de harina, etc.

“Los créditos nos ayudan a mejorar e incrementar nuestro capital y así poder salir adelante”, manifestó muy alegre doña Pilar.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y distribuir productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Pilar is 20 years old, studied until 5th year of secondary school, is married, is a mother of a small child of 2 years of age and lives in Jr. Atahualpa L-A5, in the Ilave district of the province El Collao, Puno. For the past 2 years she has been a member of a “La Ilaveñita” Communal Bank in Ilave. In the beginning, with a loan of S/. 300, she bought clothing which she sold in the market. Later she changed her business and decided to work with selling groceries. At 18 years old she started a family and could not continue with high school. She currently has her business. With this loan of S/.1,500, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 5 bags of rice, 4 of sugar, 7 of flour, etc. “The loans will help us to improve and increase our capital and through this get ahead”, Pilar expressed very happily. Her dream is to have a grocery store and distribute products wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores, es conviviente y madre de un niño de 02 años de edad. Actualmente vive en el Jr. Amazonas Nº 590, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/.500 incrementó su capital y compró más polleras y mantas, los cuales alquila en diferentes festividades. A los  25 años de edad se inició con este negocio porque no encontró trabajo y después de dos años tuvo su familia. Actualmente continúa con su negocio y abrirá una tienda más.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 03 juegos de polleras nuevas de Desaguadero para continuar con el alquiler de dichos trajes.  

“Mediante estos créditos hemos mejorado nuestros negocios” manifestó muy contenta Rosa.

Su gran deseo es crecer en su negocio y tener más tiendas para alquiler de polleras.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old, finished high school, is married and has a child who is 2 years of age. Currently, she lives Jr. Amazonas Nº 590, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno and is a member of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. With this first loan of S/.500 she increased her working capital and bought more traditional clothing which she rents for different events. At age 25 she started this business because she could not find work and after two years she started her family. Currently she has her business and will open another store. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 3 new sets of traditional skirts from Desaguadero to continue with the rental of these outfits. “Through these loans we have improved our businesses” said Rosa very happily. Her big dream is to grow her business and have more stores for the rental of traditional skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 new sets of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 49 años de edad, estudió tercer grado de primaria, es casada y madre de dos hijos (una mujer de 25 años y un varón de 21 años de edad). Vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 1301, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno, y desde hace 09 años es socia del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita” en Yunguyo.

A los 07 meses de nacida quedó huérfana de madre y a los 16 años de edad quedo huérfana de padre. Desde los 14 años de edad se fue a trabajar como vendedora de una tienda de abarrotes. Cuando cumplió 28 años formó su hogar y junto a su esposo empezaron el negocio de abarrotes como ambulantes. Desde hace 10 años aperturó una tienda de abarrotes, la cual vienen viene atendiendo hasta la fecha.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 06 cuotas, comprará con todo el capital productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes).

Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y poner más productos (surtir la tienda) y dejar un capital a sus hijos para que puedan trabajar.
texts.en:
Sabina is 49 years old, studied to third grade in primary school, is married, and is the mother of two children (a daughter who is 25 years old and a son who 21 is years of age). She lives in Jr. Arica Nº 1301, district and province of Yunguyo, Puno, and for the past 9 years she has been a member of “La Yunguyeñita” Communal Bank in Yunguyo. When she was 7 months old her mother passed ago and at 16 years of age she became an orphan with the loss of her father. Since she was 14 years old she went to work as a salesperson in a grocery store. When she turned 28 years old she formed her household and together with her husband they started a grocery business as traveling vendors. For the past 10 years she has had a grocery store which they have up to the present time. With this loan of S/.1,500, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy essential household products (groceries). Her dream is to have a big store and put more products (diversify the store) and leave some money for her children so they can work.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy essential household products (groceries).

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina cumplió 30 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 10 años de edad, vive en la Parcialidad de San José, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno y desde hace 03 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. 

Con un crédito inicial de S/.300 compró fibra de alpaca de diferentes colores para tejer (artesanía). Creció al lado de sus abuelos porque su madre la entregó desde niña. A los 20 años de edad tuvo a su hijo, al cual mantiene sin el apoyo del padre de su hijo.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 03cuotas, comprará fibra de alpaca de diferentes colores y calidad por un monto de S/.1,000, para poder tejer chompas, chalinas, chullos y chalecos, los cuales venderá a los mayoristas de las ferias de Juliaca, Puno e Ilave y con S/.500 comprará fibra de alpaca para hilar y ser comercializado.

Su sueño es tejer más y que su hijo sea profesional.

“Gracias al Banco Comunal empecé a trabajar, además nos enseñan a ser puntuales y responsables”, manifestó Sabina, muy alegre.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 30 year old high school graduate who is the single mother of a 10 year old boy. She lives in La Parcialidad de San Jose, which is in the conduriri district of the El Collao Puno province. She has been a partner in the Marioa Parado de Bellido community bank of Conduriri for 3 years. With her initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased alpaca wool in different color to use in weaving handicrafts. She was raised by her grandparents, having been turned over to them by her mother when she was a small child. Her son was born when she was 20 years old, and she has supported him without any assistance from his father. With this 1,500 sol loan which she will pay in three payment, she will purchase different colored alpaca wool of varied quality for 1000 soles. She will use this to create jackets, shawls, caps and vests which she will sell wholesale to retailers in Juliaca, Puno and Ilave. With 500 soles of the loan she will purchase alpaca wool which she will spin into yarn for sale. Her dream is to do more sewing, and that her son might become a professional. "Thanks to the Community Bank I started to work, and also learned to be punctual and responsible" said a very happy Sabina.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: Santa Fisher

texts.es:
Doña Santa tiene 33 años de edad, estudió educación superior, es casada, madre de 3 hijos (todos menores de edad), vive en el  Jr. Manco Capac Interior 11 del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco  Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Con el crédito inicial de S/.300 pudo comprar más productos (detergentes,  betún, pasta dental, champú, etc.), con lo que aumentó su mercadería y le es necesario viajar a distintas comunidades. A los 15 años de edad se dedicó a la compra y venta de carne que los mismos comuneros le traían a su casa y ella  vendía en las diferentes ferias. A los 24 años tuvo su familia y continúo con su negocio conjuntamente con su esposo. 

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará,  detergente, betún, ayudin y más productos.

Su sueño es progresar y que su familia salga adelante y también ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santa is 33 years old woman who attended some college and is the mother of 3 young children. She lives in the Jr Manco capac Interior 11th district of Ilave in the provincia El Coallao Puno district. She is a partner in the San Miguel community bank in Ilave. With her initial loan of 300 soles she was able to purchase more products (detergent, shoe polish, toothpaste, shampoo, etc) which she used to increase her stock which she takes to neighboring communities. She began working buying and selling meat brought to her home by salesmen when she was 15 years old. She would take the meat to various markets to sell. When she was 24 years old she began her family and continued working with her husband. With this loan of 500 soles which she will pay off in 3 payments she will purchase detergent, shoe polish, and other products. Her dream is to progress and help her family while seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse of detergent, shoe polish, and other products.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Izcuchaca Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Señor D. Los Milagros D. Izcuchaca esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Izcuchaca en Huancavelica, es una zona turística, donD. los pobladores son quechua hablantes. Entre las actividades principales que realiza la comunidad esta la venta D. bollo (pancitos D. queso y calabaza), empanadas, chicharrones, se destaca la ganadería, agricultura y apicultura.

Daría E., es viuda, tiene 64 años y 4 hijos ya mayores, se dedica desD. hace 30 años a la venta D. chicharrones, desD. muy temprano sube a los microbuses a vender. Siempre invierte en su negocio pues es su único medio D. vida. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean felices que no sufran, que Dios les guíe el camino para que sean hombres D. bien.

Maximiliana A., tiene 4 hijos, , se dedica a la venta D. agua D. manzana y gaseosa en los carros, sus prestamos los invierte en su negocio en la compra D. baldes para la venta D. agua D. manzana y la compra D. gaseosas al por mayor. Su sueño es tener una tienda granD. y vender D. todo, así obtener mayores ingresos para el estudio D. sus hijos.

Yolanda R., es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta D. tara, ovejas y animales menores, este negocio lo realiza hace mas D. 5 años. Tuvo que afrontar con su familia el abandono D. su pareja, pero salió adelante, sus préstamos los invierte en la compra D. mas animales. Su sueño es llevar sus productos a otros departamentos y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
The communal bank "Señor D. Los Milagros D. Izcuchaca" is located in the Izcuchaca community in Huancavelica. This is a tourist area where the population are quchua speakers. Among the principal businesses in this community are the sale of "bollo" (bread with cheese and squash), empanadas and pork rinds. Livestock farming, agriculture and apiculture are also practiced in the community.

Daria E. is a widow. She is 64 years old and has four older children. For 30 years she has dedicated herself to selling pork rinds. She gets on the buses in the early hours of the day to sell. She always invests in her business as this is her only means to survive. Her dream is that her children will be happy and not suffer and that God guiD. their path so that they will be men of good.

Maximiliana Atacusi has four children. She dedicates herself to the sale of apple juice and soft drinks. She invests the loans she receives in her business by buying containers for the sale of apple juice and in buying soft drinks wholesale. Her dream is to have a large store and be able to sell all kinds of things so that she can obtain a better income that will allow her to proviD. for her children's education.

Yolanda R. is a single mother. She has three children and dedicates herself to the sale of "tara", sheep and small animals. She has been in this business for more than five years. She had to face off with her family because she left her partners but she was able to get ahead. She invests her loans in the purchase of more animals. Her dream is to be able to take her products to other areas and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business such as food production, agriculture, apiculture and soft drink sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire more clothing to sell in her small business.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria tiene 46 años de edad, estudió sexto de primaria, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos menores de 10 y 09 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Arica Nº 1333, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno y es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita” en Yunguyo.

Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró 05 ovinos para degollar y vender en carne. A los 30 años de edad tuvo su pareja y ambos empezaron el negocio de compra de ovinos para la venta en carne, y a la fecha sigue con ese negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 06 cuotas, comprará 03 ovinos, el precio depende del peso del ovino (entre S/.140 a S/.200).

Su sueño es seguir con su negocio, y sobre todo que sus hijos estudien y no estén sin trabajo.
texts.en:
Silveria is a 46 year old woman who completed the sixth grade. She is the mother of two children, ages 10 and 9, and she lives at Jr. Arica number 1333 in Yunguyo. She used her initial loan of 300 soles to purchase 5 sheep which were raised for meat. She met her spouse when she was 30 years old, and of them have worked buying sheep to sell for meat - something that they continue doing to this day. With this 500 sol loan, which they will repay in 6 payments, they will purchase 3 sheep. The price of the sheep depends on the animal's weight (between 140 and 200 soles). Her dream is to continue her business, and above all, ensure that her children attend school and never be without work.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 33 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 13 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Ampatiri, distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chuchito, Puno y es integrante del Banco Comunal “Buenavista” en Chacachaca.

Con un crédito inicial de S/.300 compró golosinas (galletas, chocolates, dulces). Desde los 15 años de edad empezó el negocio de golosinas. A los 20 años tuvo a su hija y dejó sus estudios porque más se dedicaba al negocio.

Con este crédito de S/.2,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará gaseosas de toda marca por un monto de S/.2,000 y con S/.500 comprará golosinas.

Su meta es instalar un depósito de gaseosas en el Centro Poblado de Chacachaca para vender al por mayor y al por menor y que su hija estudie para ser profesional.
texts.en:
Sofia is a 33 year old single mother who finished elementary school. She has a 13 year old daughter, and she lives in the Ampatiri neighborhood in the Pomata district of the Chuchito Puno province. She is a partner in the Buenavista community bank in Chacachaca. With her first loan of 300 soles, Sofia purchased snacks (cookies, chocolates, and candies). She has worked selling snacks since she was 15 years old. Her daughter was born when she was 20, and she left school to concentrate on work. With this 2,500 sol loan which will be repaid in 3 payments,she will purchase a variety of soft drinks for 2000 soles, and while using 500 soles to purchase snacks. her goal is to open a soft drink stand in the downtown area of Chacachaca, selling in bulk and retail amounts. She also hopes that her daughter will study and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of snaks and softdrinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Susana Zenaida

texts.es:
Susana tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, tiene estudios superiores, vive en el Jr. Libertad Nº 205, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Desde hace 04 años, con el primer préstamo de S/.300 aumentó su capital  y compró más cosméticos (perfumes, cremas de limpieza, talcos, etc.) de la línea Unique. A los 20 años de edad se inició con este negocio en el que le va muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más productos para poder tener una tienda de cosméticos.

Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y al mismo tiempo seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Susana is a single 24 year old woman who has attended some college. She lives in Jr. Libertad number 205 in the Ilave district of the El Collao Puno Province. She is a partner in the San Miguel community bank in Ilave. For the last four years, and with the first loan of 300 soles she has increased her capital and purchased additional Unique brand cosmetics, (perfume, cold creams, powders, etc.) She has been working in this business since she was 20 years old, and it has worked out very well for her. With this 2,300 sol loan which she will repay in 3 payments, she will purchase additional products which she will use to open a cosmetics store. her dream is to continue to grow her business while she continues studying.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more products to her salon.

loans.name: Felipa's Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Semillas D. Accopuquio pertenece a la comunidad D. Castilla Pata en el distrito D. Yauli en Huancavelica. La comunidad es una zona donD. las mujeres realizan tejidos D. chalinas, gorras, etc.

Felipa A., es casada, ante sufría mucho porque no contaba con capital, vendía D. 2 a 3 pares D. medias, ahora con los prestamos que recibe a invertido mas en su negocio y sus ventas son mayores, también trae sus mercadería a Lima a vender. Este año tuvo que afrontar la perdida D. su hija que falleció en un accidente, sin embargo ella quiere salir adelante y aprovecha las reuniones D. su bancomunal para aprender a ser solidaria.

Gloria Núñez, es casada tiene 2 hijos, su negocio es una tienda que antes no estaba muy surtida, ahora esta bien implementada D. productos gracias a los préstamos que recibe, antes su esposo no le dejaba realizar sus ventas, ni traer sus productos a Lima, ahora ella conversa mas con su esposo y le hace entender que es su negocio.

Verónica Q., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a la venta D. quesos, huevo, también granos y artesanías como gorros y guantes. Solo algunos D. sus hijos están estudiando otros no por la falta D. dinero. Con el terremoto del año pasado se derrumbo una D. las paredes D. su casa, perdió todo, pero le ayudaron los comuneros. Ahora es mas responsable con su capital, sus prestamos los utiliza en comprar baldes D. queso y materiales para tejer sus guantes y gorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Semillas D. Accopuquio belongs to the Castilla Pata community located in the Yauli district in Huancavelica. The community is located in an area where women knit scarves, hats, etc.

Felipa A. is married. She used to suffer a lot because she did not have any money to count on. She used to only sell two to three pairs of stockings but after receiving loans she has been able to invest in her business and her sales have increased. She has also been able to take her merchandise to Lima to sell. This year she had to face the loss of her daughter who died in an accident. However, she wants to succeed and she takes advantage of the meetings at the communal bank to learn to be responsible.

Gloria Núñez is married and has two children. She has a store which previously was not well stocked. Thanks to the loans she receives, it is now well stocked. Previously, her husband did not allow her to make her sales or to travel to Lima to bring her merchandise. However, she now speaks to him frequently and helps him understand that this is her business.

Veronica Q. is married and has five children. She sells cheeses, eggs, grains and crafts like hats and gloves. Only some of her children are in school and the others are not because there is not enough money. After last year's earthquake one of the walls of her home collapsed. She lost everything but the people in her community assited her. She is now more responsible with her money and she uses the loans she receives to purchase containers for the cheese and materials to knit her gloves and hats.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for various businesses.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 32 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores satisfactoriamente, es soltera, vive en el Jr. Independencia Nº 617 del distrito de Ilave, provincia  El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos para su tienda, como champú, perfume, productos de limpieza, etc. A los 18 años de edad empezó a vender jugo en el mercado. Posteriormente cambió de negocio por la venta de cosméticos y regalos como peluches, joyeros, joyas, artículos de perfumería, etc.

Con este crédito S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará más artículos para su perfumería.

Su gran deseo es ser empresaria y tener muchas tiendas para generar trabajo a los demás.
texts.en:
Vilma is a single 32 year old woman who completed her higher education. She lives at Jr Independencia number 617 in the Ilave district in the El Collao province of Puno, and is a partner in the San Miguel Community Bank. She used her initial 300 sol loan to purchase items for her store, including shampoo, perfume, cleaning products, etc. She began selling juice in the market when she was 18 years old. later she changed her business and began selling cosmetics and gifts, including stuffed animals, jewelry boxes, jewelry, perfume products etc. With this 500 sol loan which she will repay in 3 payments, she will purchase additional items for her perfume stand. Her greatest desire is to be a business woman and to have many stores that provide jobs to others.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of purfume and related items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add products to her inventory and thus boost her sales volume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory for a business selling clothing accessories and jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To introduce meat to her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Yene Maria

texts.es:
Yene Maria tiene 23 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de un hijo varón de 06 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Tumbes Nº 250 del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno. 

Debido a la invitación de una amiga integra el Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave y con su primer préstamo compró dos memorias para su Internet. Desde los 18 años de edad se dedica al negocio, primero empezó a con la venta de ropa (chompas, pantalones, faldas y otros) que comercializaba los días domingos en la ciudad de Ilave y desde hace 04 años hasta la fecha se dedica  al negocio de Internet. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará una computadora para su Internet.

Su meta es tener su casa propia, ampliar su Internet y apoyar a su hijo para que estudie.

“El Banco Comunal nos ayuda bastante porque es fácil de obtener crédito, no pide garantía hipotecaria” manifestó Yene Maria, muy contenta.
texts.en:
Yene Maria is 23, she went to 5th grade of secondary school, lives with her partner, has a six year old son, lives in No. 250 Jr. Tumbes, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. Through an invitation from her friend she joins the community bank “San Miguel”, in Ilave and with her first loan she bought two memories for her Internet business. Since she was 18, she worked in a business, selling clothing (sweaters, pants, skirts and other) that she sold on Sundays in the city of Ilave and four years ago she started with an internet business. With this $400 loan, to be repaid in three months, she will buy a computer for the internet business. Her goal is to own a house, expand her internet business and support his son’s education. “The community bank helps us a great deal because it’s easy to get a loan without a asking for real estate as collateral”, said Yene Maria, really happy.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 32 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta el quinto año de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos, vive en la Av. Jesús Nº 194, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita”.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar más ropa  de la ciudad de Desaguadero y vender en Arequipa. Desde los 19 años de edad se inició con la compra y venta de ropa. A los 24 años tuvo su pareja y continuó con su negocio, pero no pudo continuar sus estudios superiores por que tuvo su primer hijo y tenía que trabajar más.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará mas mercadería como: una docena de pantalones, dos docenas de casacas, juegos de ropa deportiva, etc. 

Su gran deseo es mejorar, que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32, went to 5th grade of secondary school, lives with her partner, has two children and lives on No. 194 Jesus Ave., District of Ilave, province of El Collao, Puno and she is a founder member of the community bank “La Ilaveñita”. At the beginning, with a $100 loan she raised capital to purchase clothing from Desaguadero and sell it in Arequipa. Since she was 19 she started buying and selling clothes. At 24, she met her partner and continued with the business, she wasn’t able to continue with professional studies because she had her son and she had to work even harder. With the $175 loan, to be repaid in three months, she will buy merchandise: a dozen pants, 2 dozen jackets, sport sets, etc. Her great wish is to get better, see her business grow and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 33 años de edad, curso hasta el tercero de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, vive el Jr. Ica s/n, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y desde hace un año es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”. 

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/.300, compró verduras, papa, carne, etc.,  para seguir preparando viandas (comida). Se dedica a este negocio desde hace varios años. Sus padres no tenían medios económicos y por esa razón no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios y ello la obligó a trabajar desde los 20 años de edad. A esa edad empezó a vender comida en el mercado y a los 26 años formó su hogar y continuó con su negocio; ella decidió seguir adelante.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará  arroz, verduras, carne, aceite, azúcar, gas, etc.

“Gracias a los créditos que obtuve de los Bancos Comunales  podemos seguir adelante y ya no dependemos de nuestros esposos”, manifestó Yolanda.

Su mayor deseo es tener un Restaurante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 33, went to 3rd grade of secondary school, lives with her partner, has four small children, lives in Jr. Ica, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, Puno and has been a member of the community bank “ San Miguel” for a year. At the beginning, with a $100 loan, she bought vegetables, potatoes, meat, etc, to continue preparing food. She has worked on this business for a few years. Her parents didn’t have the means and that’s why she couldn’t finish secondary school and that forced her to work since she was 20. At that age she started selling food in the market and at 26 she started a home and continued with the business, she decided to keep going. With this loan of $275, to be repaid in three months, she will buy rice, vegetables, meat, oil, sugar, gas, etc. “Thanks to the loans from the community banks we can keep going and we don’t depend on our husbands anymore”, said Yolanda. Her biggest wish is to have a restaurant and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, oil, sugar, vegetables, gas.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 41 años de edad, estudió segundo grado de primaria, es casada, madre de 05 hijos (uno con familia y cuatro solteros), vive en el Barrio Miraflores, distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno y desde hace un año y medio es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri.

En un inicio, con un préstamo de S/.300, compró papa, chuño, arroz y verduras para cocinar en su restaurante. Sus padres eran pobres y ellas eran 06 hermanas que no pudieron estudiar. Crecieron al lado de otras personas y desde los 16 años de edad salió a vender frutas y golosinas en Conduriri. A los 18 años tuvo su pareja e instaló un restaurante que hasta la fecha viene funcionando, también se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca conjuntamente con su esposo, entrega semanalmente a los mayoristas de Tacna entre 04 y 05 degollados.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 07 degollados de carne, dependiendo del precio el cual oscila entre S/.120 y S/.150 cada uno.

Su meta es poner una tienda de abarrotes en Conduriri y que sus hijos menores estudien para que puedan trabajar.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 41, went to second grade, is married, has five children (one with family and four single), she lives in the Miraflores neighbourhood, district of Conduriri, province of El Collao, Puno, and has been for a year a member of the community bank “Maria Parado de Bellido” in Conduriri. At the beginning, with a $100 loan, she bought potatoes, rice, vegetables to cook in her restaurant. Her parents were poor and had six daughters that couldn’t study. They grew up around other people and at 16 she went to sell fruits and snacks in Conduriri. At 18, she met her partner and started a restaurant that to this date is still up and running, she also buys and sells alpaca meat with her husband, they make weekly deliveries to wholesalers in Tacna, delivering four to five of them. With this loan of $325, to be repaid in three months, she will buy seven alpacas for meat, depending on the price, which varies between 40 and 50 each. Her goal is to have a general store in Conduriri and to see her young children study and be able to get a job.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpaca meat to sell

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer. Rosa es casada y tiene 41 años y 2 hijos uno de 18 años y el otro de 7 meses, su primer hijo ya terminó el colegio.

Rosa tiene su negocio de peluquería hace muchos años , también tiene otro negocio un carro que lo hace trabajar en el servicio de taxi y desde hace 6 años vende ropa interior . Rosa desde que recibe los préstamos ha ido creciendo sus negocios , ha comprado más vitrinas para colocarlas en su peluquería, cada vez está mejorando y se siente mas tranquila.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento a su carro y también va a comprar mas mercadería (ropa interior). Rosa sueña con tener más carros para hacerlos trabajar en el servicio de taxi y formar su propia empresa , también quisiera tener un bazar bien surtido y establecido en un buen lugar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Amanecer. Rosa is 41 years old, is married and has two children ages 18 years old and 7 months old. Her first child already finished high school.

Rosa has owned a barbershop for several years. She also runs a taxi service. She has also sold lingerie for six years. Since Rosa has been receiving loans she has been expanding her business. She purchased more display cabinets for her shop. She is getting ahead every day and she feels calmer.

Rosa needs a loan in the amount of $ 725 which she will invest in the maintenance of her car and to purchase more merchandise (lingerie). Rosa's dream is to have more cars for her taxi service so that she can form her own company. She would also like to have her own well-stocked store in a good area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of taxi and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada , tiene 2 hijos, de 21 y 31 años Julia vende cosméticos desde hace 18 años , también alquila departamentos y desde hace 2 meses se dedica la tejido

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en los acabados, infraestructura e implementación, de departamentos para alquilar, va a colocar ventanas . Julia desde que recibe los préstamos ha podido crecer y avanzar en sus proyectos. Los sueños de Julia construir mas departamentos y formar una empresa.
texts.en:
