Es un humilde agricultor, que se desempeña desde su niñez en las tareas del campo, ahora  trabaja en la venta y compra de animales al por mayor, de los cuales, consigue lo necesario para solventar a su familia, para ello, con sus propias manos ha construido su establo, para poner ahí a sus animales, y luego de varios meses de alimentación balanceada los vende en las ferias ganaderas, donde va con toda su familia. También se dedica al cultivo de maíz y papa, en pequeñas cantidades, pero si tiene mayores extensiones de alfalfa con la que alimentar a sus animales.  Herminio trabaja por la responsabilidad de ser sustentador de su familia, esa es su razón de ser. Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá preparar sus tierras de cultivo, con abono y fertilizantes, y también sembrar alfalfa. En un futuro desea tener un establo más espacioso  y mejorar la calidad de sus animales.
texts.en:
Herminio is 35 years old. Currently he lives with his wife and their two small children. He is a humble farmer, who has worked on the tasks of the farm since he was a child. Now he works selling and buying animals for a profit, which has given him what he needs to meet the expenses of his family. For this, with his own hands he built a stable in order to keep his animals inside. Later, over several months of careful feeding he sells them in the markets, where he goes with his entire family. He also works growing corn and potatoes in small quantities, but he has more land in alfalfa with which he feeds his animals. Herminio works to meet the responsibility of supporting his family; this is his reason to be. He asks for this loan, with which he would be able to prepare his lands for farming with fertilizer, and to grow alfalfa. In the future he would like to have a larger stable and to improve the quality of his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Chhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhai N. lives in the village of Prey Chroum in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Chhai N. is 36-year-old and the mother of three children. All the children are enrolled in school. She sells Chinese noodles to villagers and passengers. She is her family's primary breadwinner but her business doesn't earn enough to support her household well.

In order to improve her family's living conditions, she is requesting a loan to buy a horse and cart for her husband, Mr. Shon Lo, to start a business transporting goods to earn additional income. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a horse and cart for her husband start a transport business

loans.name: Damaris De La Concepcion

texts.es:
La joven Damaris Concepción Gálvez R. con 24 años de edad, la cual su estado civil es de casada, ella tiene 3 niños con edades de: 3, 5 y 7 años los niños con edades de 5 y 7 años de edad cursan la primaria en una escuela  pública el niño de 3 años no estudia, la señora  recibe apoyo de su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como transportista de carga pesada, el señor trabaja en lugares como occidente, Managua y otros  departamentos para que de esta forma ambos puedan aportar cierta fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que sus hijos todavía están en una etapa en la que necesitaran la ayuda de poder terminar sus estudios.

 El fin que tendría el destino de esta inversión seria para poder invertir fuertemente en su negocio en el capital de trabajo que seria para la compra de mercadería  ya que es su actividad  económica  como es ropa, calzado, cosméticos  y otros para ofrecerle todo a sus clientes la forma como ella logra vender mas es realizándolo de manera ambulante, la idea que ella tiene es de poder comprar una vitrina, estante y todo tipo de accesorio para establecerse en su casa para que ella de este modo poder permanecer mas tiempo con su familia, otras de las cosas que Doña Damaris desea es incrementar y tener una variedad de  productos en el negocio, ella da inicia en esta actividad  de forma ambulante comercializando en sectores aledaños a su comunidad hace dos años y surge de la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos de su casa por lo que su esposo no estaba trabajando por lo que como mujer emprendedora tuvo  la idea de empezar a vender ropa y aumentar un poco mas su capital e ingresos familiares
texts.en:
The young Damaris Concepcion G. R. is 24 years old and she married and has three children, aged 3, 5 and 7 years. The two children aged 5 and 7 are attending a public school and the three-year old stays at home. This young Mom receives support from her husband. He works as a truck driver, working in the west, in Managua and other regions. The both work hard so that there are two incomes to support the family, especially their children that require so much just to finish school.

The funds of this loan will be invested in her business as working capital, to purchase merchandise. She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics and she wishes to offer her clients these products. She sells her products door to door, but she would like to set up a small shop or stand in her home. This way she will be able to spend more time with her family. Deamaris wishes to also increase the selection of the products she offers in her business. She has been selling in her region for the last 2 years and she now sees the need to contribute more towards the house hold expenses. Her husband found himself without work, and she being a hard worker, she decided to start up a business selling clothing to increase the family income.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mr. Ung K. was born in 1948 and lives in Kor Village in Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Pul Bo, are farmers. They are faced with a serious obstacle because their field is not fertile and is producing poor crop yields. To solve this problem, Mr. Ung K. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to produce better crops. He hopes to increase his rice revenue and improve his family's living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
Don José Pedro A.  M. tiene  la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es  casado, tiene 4 hijos sus nombres son: Sara Rymunda Bracamonte tiene 26 años de edad y cursa recientemente el 5 año de derecho, Salvador Alexander tiene 23 años y trabaja con su papa, su otro hijo Julio Cesar cursa el 1 año de Ingeniería industrial quien tiene 20 años y  su otra hija  Leticia Del Carmen tiene 19 años y no estudia es madre soltera, su compañera de vida Doña María Elsa Bracamonte es maestra de primaria  del colegio modesto Armijo de subtiava, las aspiraciones que Don José es poder tener un taller de alfarería de barro mas tecnificado para poder terminar la formación académica de sus hijos, ya que con mucho esfuerzo  ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus  estudios.

Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación que es de los pescaditos 1c. Al sur 1/2c. al oeste, en el barrio de sutiava , el negocio que Don José tiene es el de alfarería el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 20 años , dando inicio en este rubro a través de un curso que le ofrecieron estando aun trabajando como educador, dicha experiencia le agrado y  de ahí nace la idea de instalar su propio taller que en la actualidad de su fuente de ingresos, además fue en esa experiencia que conoce a su esposa, cabe destacar que de su trabajo lo mandaron a instruirse para enseñarle a los niños discapacitados o que sufren del síndrome de Down pero que en 1985 renuncio a trabajar como profesor porque el salario no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia   y de este modo decidió trabajar la alfarería por su cuenta, la inversión la  utilizaría para  la compra de capital de trabajo como seria comprando mas tierra, arena y barro los productos que mas logra vender son: floreros, macetera, copas y platos de barro. En su visión como alfarero esta a parte de tecnificar su taller el poder exportar su productos.
texts.en:
Jose Pedro A. M. is 52 years old and married. He has four children whose names are Sara Rymunda Bracamonte, who is 26 and in her 5th year of studying law, Salvador Alexander who is 23 and works with his father, Julio Cesar who is 20 and in his first year studying industrial engineering, and Leticia del Carmen who is 19 and doesn't study since she is a single mother. His wife is Maria Else Bracamonte who works teaching elementary school at the Modesto Armijo de Subtiava school. Jose would like to have a pottery workshop that is more technical which will help to finance his children's studies which he has been able to do up till now with great effort. His business is located in his home in the Sutiava neighborhood. He has run his pottery workshop for the past 20 years; he took a pottery class while he was working as an educator and he loved it so he decided to start his own workshop which now is the source of the majority of his income. Through the class, he also met his wife. Prior to starting his shop, he taught children with disabilities or those that suffer from Down syndrome; but in 1985, he quit his job as a professor because the pay was insufficient to support his family. He decided to work on his own in his pottery shop. He will use this loan to finance his business by purchasing more clay, sand, and dirt. He primarily sells flowerpots, windowboxes, and ceramic plates and cups. By improving his workshop, he would eventually like to export his goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ethelvina

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Ethelvina Hernández con la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos sus nombres son: Humberto Francisco Palacios tiene 35 años de edad es soltero y es ingeniero industrial, lamentablemente no trabaja le ayuda a su papa en la agricultura su otra hija es Maryori Palacios tiene 32 años de edad y es Lic. En biología trabaja en la universidad de león y es casada, el compañero de vida de Doña  Ethelvina es agricultor ya que tiene una pequeña finquita con su ganado. Las aspiraciones que ella tiene es poder ampliar su negocio, y acondicionar un pequeño lugar en su casa donde instalar su pequeño negocio de productos lácteos.

La señora Ethelvina  tiene 15 años de poseer el negocio, la actividad económica del negocio es de ventas de productos lácteos como leche, crema y queso fresco,  esta ubicado en su casa de habitación que es donde fue la proquinsa   1c.oeste 1/2c. al norte, en león, dando inicio en este negocio, como una opción a poder obtener otros ingresos ya que la mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado al magisterio es decir a impartir clases de primaria  en la escuela hermita de dolores de san Felipe y de este modo forma a sus 2 hijos y ahora esta jubilada, anteriormente entregaba la leche en la finca pero la vendía a bajo precio después se decidió a trasladar a su casa y vender estos productos como son: crema, queso y borona ella piensa usar el financiamiento para comprar mas concentrado para su ganado y de mejor calidad ya que  este le generaría mas rendimiento en su producción, razón por la cual requiere de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
The lady named Ethelvina H., 62, her civil status is married, she has two sons whose names are Humberto Francisco Palacios, who is 35,single and an industrial engineer who unfortunately doesn't work and helps his dad with agriculture; her other child is Maryori Palacios, who is 32. She works in biology in the University of Leon and is married. Ehelvina's husband is a farmer now that he has a small plot from hisearnings. The aspiration she has is to grow her business and condition a small place in her house where she can install he small dairy business.E

Ms. Ethelvina has had her business for 15 years, which is to sell dairy products like milk, cream, and fresh cheese, it is located in the house which is located at 1c west, 1/2c north in Leon. Starting this business as an option to be able to get another source of income, after devoting the majority of her life to teaching, which is to say that she taught primary school classes in the Dolores de San Felipe school and this is how she raised her two children. Now she is retired. Before she sold milk in the estate, but she sold it for lower prices later she decided to move the business to her house and sell the products which are:cream, cheese and she is thinking of using the financing to buy more food for her livestock and to improve the quality now that she is more dedicated to her production, which is why she needs financing.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Suo Chan Thea's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group of Chamka Tamao Village in Kampong Chhnang Province consists of fifteen people. Each plans to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. S. C. T. is a housewife who cooks a delicious food for her household. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is employed in a small position in a hotel. Since her children's workplace is too far from house, they spend a lot of money on transportation. Thus, Mrs. S. C. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work. Mrs. Sok T.'s husband is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom C. D. was born in 1987 and lives in Taseng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She has a child who is too young to work or study, being just seven months old.She rears pigs for a living, of which she currently has five. Since her pigs are growing bigger she does not have enough money to buy them adequate food. Thus she is requesting a loan to buy food for this purpose.

Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chandara, transports goods and passengers by motorbike for a living.

loans.use: To buy more food for the pigs she raises

loans.name: Mr. Pen Samuth's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen members of Chamka Tamao Village in Kampong Chhnang Province got together to form a group loan, which each will use for different purposes. Mr. Pen S. is the village bank president selected by the members. He is 37 years old and the father of three children, one of whom attends the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study, being just three and five years old. He is a motorbike taxi driver and pig breeder. Since his second business is doing well, he wants to expand it sois requesting a loan to buy two more pigs to breed. His wife, Mrs. Ti Back Theary, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household.

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs to breed

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng L. S. was born in 1981 and lives in Kor Village in Kandal Province. She is 27 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. She owns a plot of land on which she could cultivate rice. However, she cannot currently do so because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to support her field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Preab Yan, is a grocer in the local village.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mr. Nhoem C. is a villager in Krodas Village in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Bo Koem, are farmers. They cannot cultivate rice because they do not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant. Thus, Mr. Nhoem C. is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. The couple has six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while other two attend the local school. The youngest is too young to work or study, being just five years old. Mrs Bo Keom is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mali

texts.en: Mrs. Mali S. M. was born in 1975 and lives in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province.She is a 33-year-old widow without any children. She has a plot of land on which she plans to cultivate rice to earn a living. However, she currently does not have enough money to buy more rice seeds, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her rice revenue and improve living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum N. is a villager in Tropang Chhouk in Takeo Province. She is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is one year old, so that child is too young to work or study. She is a famer and has a plot of land on which she plans to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Chhim Sophea (on the right in the photo) is a laborer earning $3 a day, which is too little to support their family. Although they each have different businesses, the couple has not been able to improve their family's living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Chum N. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to breed, and then sell.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed and sell

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban K. S. is a villager in Cheur TealSrut Kroum Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. She is a 51-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are employed in different businesses while the rest attend the local school. Since her children's work place is too far from the family home, they usually spend a large portion of their income money on transportation. To save money, Mrs. Ban K. S. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her children, thus hoping to reduce her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children

loans.name: Oeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurng S. is a villager in Trapaing Krasang Village in Takeo Province, and breeds pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so is requesting a loan to buy six more piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food. She is a 27-year-old widow with three children, one of whom attends the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are just one and five years old.

loans.use: To buy six more piglets and more pig food.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas C. was born in 1949 and lives in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ngaet Pon, have a piece of land on which they plan to cultivate rice. They have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The remaining three attend the local school. Although Mrs. Meas C.’s family members have different businesses, they still don't earn enough in total to afford building another room in their house. Thus, Mrs. Meas C. is requesting a loan to buy timber to add another room. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build another room in her family home

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Mrs. Pum V., 46, lives in Krouch Seuch Village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a small piece of land on which she plans to cultivate rice. However, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Pum V. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. Her husband (on the right in the photo) is a fisherman who can only catch a few fish to help supplement his wife's earnings from growing rice. The couple has four children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice crop

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun S. lives in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school.She rears pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy six more piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the money to buy more pig food. Her husband, Mr. Ven Ping (on the right in the photo), owns a small piece of land on which he can cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy six more piglets and more pig food

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nun S. lives in Bakong Keit Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece land on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Chhoy Technich, is a worker a in bicycle repair store. Since his workplace is far from home, he spends a lot of money on transportation, so Mrs. Nun S. is requesting a loan to help buy him a motorbike for traveling to work.

Thus, she hopes to reduce family expenses and improve her living conditions. Mrs. Nun S. is 37 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use in traveling to work.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang H. was born in 1979 and lives in Phdao Chukiet Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. She is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since her ducks have recently delivered a lot of ducklings, she does not have enough money to buy enough duck food for them all. Thus she is requesting a loan to buy duck food. Her husband, Mr. Hoar Hoeurn, is a pig breeder. He is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more duck food

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget T. is a villager in Andoung Thmor Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hao T., own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. They have four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Although Mrs. Nget T.’s family members have jobs, they still cannot afford to build a house so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this new loan of $300. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Ti

texts.en: Mrs. Ti C. is a villager in Srey Chey Village in Takeo Province. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school. She owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Chhil Chha, works in a print shop and earns part of the income for their family. Although Mrs. Ti C. and her husband both work, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Ti C. would like a loan of $500 to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after selling the cow. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: Mr. Loem D. lives in Tasen Village in Kampong Cham Province. He uses his motorbike to carry a cart in order to transport goods and passengers for a fee. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his cart is too old, which make his passengers uncomfortable. Thus, he would like a loan of $500 to buy a new cart to replace the old one. Mr. Loem D. is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom helps him in the current business while the remaining three are attending the local school.His wife, Mrs. Chhorn Sambour, is a housewife who takes care of her family and appears with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike transport cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Heom

texts.en: Mr. Heom S. lives in Trapaing Pong Village in Takeo Province. He is 66 years old and married with four children. Three of his children are employed in a garment factory worker and the youngest one attends the local school. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns $4 a day, which is a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Samrith Oeurn, is a farmer. Even though Mr. Heom S. and his wife both have jobs, they still cannot support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Heom S. would like a loan of $500 to buy a cow for breeding. His wife appears with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun B. lives in Angkunh Village in Takeo Province. She has a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a 51-year-old widow with three children who are all employed in a garment factory. Although Mrs. Chhun B.'s family members all have jobs, they cannot improve their standard of living. Mrs. Chhun B. would like a loan of $375 to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions after she sells that cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mr. Chin S. lives in Sras Pring village in Kampong Cham Province. He owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn his living. On his plantation, he now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which affects his crop. To solve this problem, he would like a loan of $125 to buy fertilizers to ammend the field. His wife, Mrs. Ur Pha, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Chin S. is 50 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is a driver and one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one attends the local school. His wife appears with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to ammend his rice field.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin Y. was born in 1962 and lives in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Hoy Loem, is a cow vendor who buys cows for breeding and re-sells them later at better price. This business is going well and they want to expand it so she would like a loan of $250 to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Chin Y. hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions by selling the cows. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Mrs. Tes S. lives in Chamlak Village in Takeo Province. She is 43 years old and the mother of seven children, one of whom is a driver, and four attend the local school; the remaining two stay at home because they are too young to work or study. Mrs. Tes S. is a housewife who cooks very delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Tes Vath, is a driver for a company. His work place is far from their house and he spends a lot of money on transportation. Mrs. Tes S. is asking for a loan of $500 to add to her savings, which she will use to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute. He appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to his work place.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat P. was born in 1961 and now lives in Chamlak Be Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. On the plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile which is affecting her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Khat P. would like a loan of $250 to buy fertilizers to ammend the field and make the crop more productive. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Run Thorn, repairs bicycles in the local village. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to ammend her field and increase crop productivity.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Mr. Phoeun P. was born in 1965 and lives in Kvet village in Kampong Cham Province. He is married with two children who attend the local school. Mr. Phoeun P. owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn his living. His wife, Mrs. Horn Oeun, is a pig breeder who has 12 animals. Her pigs are growing bigger and she does not have enough money to feed them. Mr. Phoeun P. would like a loan of $275 to buy pig feed. He hopes this loan will increase the family's standard of living. They have two father of two children who attend the local school. His wife appears with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Mrs. Duk S. is a farmer in Thaom Ney Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Koem Sotheara, is a policeman who earns a small salary for the family. They have four children, two of whom attend the local school. The remaining two are too young to work or study because they are 1 and 3 years old. Although Mrs. Duk S. and her husband both have jobs, they still cannot support their family the way they would like to. Thus, Mrs. Duk S. would like a loan of $350 to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions after she sells her cow. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Pm

texts.en:
Pm S. T. is 38 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their four children. She is a housewife managing the family and the household. Her husband Khork Say is 49 years old and works at CIMAX organization and earns on average $8 per day. Two of her children go to school, one is too young for school, and her oldest son works as a tuk-tuk driver where he earns about $5 per day (a tuk-tuk is a seated cart pulled by motorbike that is used as transportation/taxi by people in Cambodia). Her household expenses are about $160 per month.

Pm S. T. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike that would help her husband commute to work. This would cut down on commute time, and save money since they would not have to pay a moto-taxi for his daily commute. Also, Pm S. T. would like to open a grocery stand in the future.

Pm S. T. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at:

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: Pm Sokun Thear is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike helping her husband commute to work daily. This would cut down on commute time, and save money since they would not have to pay a moto-taxi for his daily commute. In the future, Pm Sokun Thear would like to open a grocery stand.

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Uon K. is 27 years old and lives in the Siem Reap Province with her husband and one child. She has been working as a tailor since 2005, and works out of her home earning on average $5 per day. Her husband Lim Doeun is 29 years old, and works as a tuk-tuk driver (a tuk-tuk is motorbike pulled seated cart used as transportation/taxi by people in Cambodia) earning on average $5 per day. Their child is too young to go to school. Their household expenses are about $170 per month.
Uon K. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate.  Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan.

loans.use: Uon Khin is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine to expand her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.name: Mun

texts.en: Mrs. Mun P. lives in Kor village in Kandal Province. She is 40-year-old widow of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory; the other four children attend the local school. Mrs. Mun P. owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn her living. Although Mrs. Mun P. and her two children have jobs, they do not have enough money to support their expenses. Mrs. Mun Phal would like a loan of $500 to buy pigs and rice seed. She hopes this loan will increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pigs and rice seed.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen P. lives in Pour Roung Village in Takeo Province. She is married with three children who attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Eth Oun, own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. On their plantation, they cannot cultivate rice because they do not have enough animals to plow. Mrs. Pen P. would like a loan of $250 to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. With the rest of the loan, she would buy fertilizers and pesticides to support her crop. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S. lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and one child. She has been selling fish since 2006 at the local market, and earns on average about $5 per day. Her husband, Pik Kung, is a tuk-tuk driver (a tuk-tuk is motorbike pulled seated cart used as transportation/taxi by people in Cambodia) and fisherman earning about $10 per day. Their child is 15 years old, and attends school. Their household expenses are about $190 per month which includes food, utilities, and education.

Seng S. is requesting a loan to purchase a fishing net for her husband. She would like to buy a fishing net because it is currently the rainy season and fish are plentiful. The rainy season is also a difficult season to run a tuk-tuk business since the roads can be flooded and muddy.

Seng S. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: Purchase fishing net for her husband.

loans.name: Inh

texts.en: Mrs. Inh S. lives in Prey Tamao Village in Takeo Province. She is 31 years old and married with three children who all attend  the local school. She owns a piece of land where she can cultivate rice. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have animals to plow and must hire someone to do this. Mrs. Inh S. would like a loan of $500 for this purpose. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tith Torn, is a laborer. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S. was born in 1960. She now lives in Deum Pour Village in Takeo Province. She has a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

She now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which badly affects her crop. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help her field and to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Touch Phen, is a construction worker who can earn $3.50 per day. This is a small income to support his family. They have two children who are all attending the local school.

Mrs. S.'s husband is in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to help make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en:
Mrs. Neak H. is a villager in Trapeang Pring Village in the Takeo Province. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children. Both of her children attend the local school.

She has a small grocery business and she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sreng, repairs bikes. Though both work, they still have poor living conditions.

In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Neak H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Mr. Heng Sreng is also in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.name: Loeny

texts.en:
Loeny S. V. is 23 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and two children. She has been selling desserts in front of her home since 2004, and earns about $3.50 per day. Her husband, Sm Visal, is 25 and owns a parking lot earning $2.50 per day. Their oldest child goes to school and the other is too young to attend. Their average household expenses are $50 per month.

Loeny S. V. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: Purchase a motor-bike for her husband to commute to work, and also to increase her own business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan N. is a villager in Leab Village in the Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice.

However, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers so she can make her land more productive and grow more crops. She would also use the loan to buy more pesticides to kill insects.

Mrs. Chan N. is a 40 year old widow with five children. Two of her children work as immigrants in Malaysia. The other three children attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Veth

texts.en:
Mrs. Veth K. is a villager in Thaom Ney Village in the Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Phan Phorn, is a fisherman. He gathers fish to support his family.

Although Mrs. Veth K. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve their living situation, Mrs. Veth K. has decided to ask for a loan. She will save the loan so she can purchase timbers, which she will use to build a new house.

She hopes this loan will allow her family members to live in better conditions.

Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings so she can buy timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Sheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sheang Y. was born in 1969. She lives in Chambok Village in the Takeo Province. She is a grocer and she owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband Mr. Nou Sovanra is a farmer.

Even though, they have different careers they do not make enough money to earn a good living. Also, they face difficulty because their field does not have a productive crop.

Therefore, Mrs. Sheang Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the plantation. She hopes this loan will increase her income and improve their living conditions.

She is the mother of a child who attends the local school.

Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the plantation

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mr. Eng L. was born in 1982. He now lives in Phnaov Village in the Kampong Cham Province. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife Mrs. Von Saing owns a small store where she sells fried bananas. Even though Mr. Eng L. and his wife have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions.

Thus, Mr. Eng L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a Tuk Tuk cart. This cart is pulled by a motorbike and will provide him with a news business opportunity.

He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this new loan.

Mr. Eng L. has five children. Two of his children attend the local school. His youngest child is only two years hold and too young to work or study.

His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk cart

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Ouk H. is a villager in Pnouv Lek Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a garment worker in a factory. Her husband Mr. Phon KimH. is a motorbike driver.

Even though they have differenct careers they do not make enough money to earn a good living. Therefore Mrs. Ouk H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a Tuk Tuk cart. She wants to start a new business as a Tuk Tuk driver. She hopes this loan will increase her income and help to improve her living conditions.

She is 30 years old and the mother of one child. Her child is too young to work or study.

Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk cart

loans.name: Mrs. Noeurng Taing's Villge Bank Group

texts.en:
This loan will be distributed among the members of a village bank. The group consists of nine people. They all live in the Peak Bang’aong Village in Takeo Province. The group members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Noeurng Taing is a village bank president. She owns land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, her land has become less fertile. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers which will help to make her crop more productive. Her husband Mr. Men Meth is a construction worker who earns a small income to help support his family.

Mrs. Noeurng Taing is 31 years old and the mother of three childR.. Two of her childR. are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is only five years old and too young to work or study.

The picture shows all of the members of the group. Mr. Pol V. could not be present so his wife stands in the picture instead.

All of the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans. This means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the plantation

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Азимова Фотима, 1988 года рождения. Она торгует детскими  одеждами, начала свой бизнес вместе с матерю. Сейчас у нее 4 года опыта в этом бизнесе. У нее в продаже в основном имеются детская одежда и головные уборы. Также в продаже у нее можно найти головные уборы для религиозных людей. Свой товар она закупает у местных производителей, у поставщиков из Коканда и продает на Центральном рынке Гисарского района. Фотима хочет расширить семейный бизнес и открыть еще одну точку для продажи женской одежды. 
Ну а на данный момент Фотима хочет хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони, для закупа головных уборов
texts.en:
Fotima A. was born in 1988. She has a business selling children's clothing which she has started together with her mother. She has four years of experience in this business. She is selling mostly children's clothes and women headdresses as well as head covers for religious people. She buys the merchandise from local manufacturers and suppliers from Kokand and sells on the central market of the Gissar region. Fotima wants to expand her family business and open another location to sell women's clothing. At this time Fotima wants to get a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$600) to purchase a stock of headdresses.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy headdresses

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab C. is a villager in Svay Village in the Kandal Province. She is ingle and she is a garment worker. Aside from this work, she also owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn for living.

Her farm work is difficult because does not own any animals to plow the rice field. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire laborer with two oxen and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Mrs. Sear S. O. is a villager in Angk Chrey Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her rice plantation is 3-hectares and her vegetable field is 2 hectares.

The fields are too big for only the family to cultivate, so she has decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work on the field. With the rest of the loan she will purchase fertilizers and pesticides to produce a better crop.

Her husband Mr. Nhem Hoeurn is a bike repairer in the local village.

Mrs. Sear S. O. is 52 years old and the mother of two children. One child is a motorbike repairer while the youngest child attends the local school.

Her husband and child are presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work the field and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to produce a better crop

loans.name: Choum

texts.en:
Mr. Choum C. was born in 1973. He lives in Pnouv Lek Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a laborer who works in the fields.

He also owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife Mrs. Lo Saveun is a farmer. Even though they have different jobs, they do not make enough money to earn a good living. Therefore Mr. Choum C. has decided to ask for a loan to start a new business. He will buy ducks and duck food to start the business. He hopes this new business will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

He is a father of three young children.

His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducks and duck food

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
Ашуров Рахим, 1961 года рождения, он женат и у них 5 детей. Рахим занимается необычным бизнесом, он производит и продает «Нос» (национальный табак).  Этот бизнес он унаследовал от своих родителей. На продаваемый им товар всегда есть спрос, так как местное население пользуются его товаром как например курение сигарет. Этот вид товара пользуется известностью и потребностью, придаваемое успокоение этого продукта ничем не сравнить, говорит Рахим.
Чтоб производить этот продукт Рахиму нужен табак, который является основным ингредиентом. Для закупа табака он хочет получить займ в сумме 4500 сомони.
texts.en:
Rahim A., was born in 1961, he is married and has 5 children. Rahim has an unusual business, he makes and sells “Nos” (traditional tobacco). He inherited this business from his parents. Rahim’s products are always in demand, since local residents use his product just like they would smoke cigarettes. This product enjoys popularity and demand, nothing can compare to the calmness that this product provides, Rahim says.

In order to make his product, Rahim needs to purchase tobacco, which is the main ingredient. Rahim would like to borrow 4500 somoni ($1200) in order to purchase tobacco.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tobacco

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay T. is a villager in Konsoum Ork Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and has a plot of land. Her husband Mr. Sor Soka works in security.

Even though they have different careers, they do not make enough money to earn a good living.

Thus, Mrs. Svay T. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings. This will allow her to purchase a new home for her and her family.

She is 40 years old and the mother of two children. Both of her children attend the local school.

Her husband is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a new house

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap M. is single, 28 years old, and works very hard as a farmer and as a wood carver who makes items for sale. She owns three hectares of land, and earns about $3 per day. She lives with her mother, who makes a living raising pigs. Pheap and her mother need a loan of $1,100 to buy a small truck that they can use for plowing and transport. The loan will help them increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a small truck for plowing and transport

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Холов Шухрат, 1972 года рождения, он женат и у них 3 детей. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хлеба. Бизнесом занимается уже 5 лет. Сейчас Шухрат продает товары народного потребления и продукты питания на дехканском рынке Гисара. В его ассортименте можно увидеть макаронные изделия, разновидность масел для приготовления пищи, сахар и сахарная продукция, дрожи, разновидность зубной пасты и стиральных порошков. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах Сафар-Центра. Провожая своих покупателей любезными словами, оставляет хорошее впечатление.  
Шухрату нужны средства для закупа растительного масла и он хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони.
texts.en:
Shuhrat K. was born in 1972, he is married and has 3 children. He started his business by selling bread. Shuhrat has been in business for 5 years now. Today he sells ethnic products and food products at the Gissar farmer’s market. His product assortment includes pastas, oils for cooking food, sugar and confectionary products, yeast, and a variety of toothpastes and detergents. Shuhrat purchases his products at the wholesale stores in Safar-Center. Shuhrat says goodbye to his customers with nice words, leaving a good impression.

Shuhrat needs funds to purchase vegetable oil and he would like to take out a loan for 1500 somoni ($450).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetable oil

loans.name: Yeam

texts.en:
Mr. Yeam V. is a farmer in Snoul Village in the Takeo Province. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates rice.

He faces a small hurdle in cultivating his field because he does not own animals to help plow the rice field. Therefore, he has decided to ask for a loan so he can hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice fied. With the rest of the loan, he will buy fertilizers to support his crop.

His wife Mrs. Toun Sophea is a housewife. She cooks food for the family and takes care of the children. Mr. Yeam V. is 37 years old and the father of two children. The children attend the local school. After they study, they help the family by breeding hens.

Mrs. Toun Sophea is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Saram

texts.en: Mrs. Saram Y., 44, is a rice farmer. She is married and has four young children, three of whom help her on the farm while the other one goes to school. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Hun, is 45 years old and sells carvings using wood he gets from a local forest. The family lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. To improve her farm, Saram and her husband need a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250) to buy one buffalo and an additional plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo and a plot of farmland

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long A. is a villager in Okrolang Doul Village in the Takeo Province. She is a nurse and she has a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband Mr. Verk Shout is a farmer. Although they have different businesses, they do not earn enough money to make a good living.

They also face a small problem in cultivating their field because they do not own animals to plow the rice field. They also need fertilizer to make their crops more productive.

Thus, Mrs. Long A. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy oxen and fertilizer to support her field. She hopes this loan will increase her income and help to improve their standard of living.

She is 51 years old and the mother of two children. On of the children attends the local school and the other child has a job.

Mr. Verk Shout is standing on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy oxen and  fertilizer to support her field

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok C. is a villager in Tashoue village in Takeo Province. She is a grocer and she has a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. El Sopheak, is a farmer and works in security at the market. Although they have different businesses, they still do not enough money to earn a good living. Thus, Mrs. Sok C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy goods for her business. She hopes this loan will increase and improve her living conditions. She is 25 years old and the mother of one child, who is three years old. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Prossy Lutaaya’S Group

texts.en:
Prossy is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children aged between 10 and 3 years. All three children go to school. Prossy doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She is a very responsible member within her group. She resides in a six-room house where she is staying with six people. They have electricity and piped water at home.

The family gets three meals a day. Prossy resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Prossy has a poultry farm at her home. She has at least 350 birds on her farm and she gets 10 trays of eggs daily. She sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail.

Prossy receives an average of 20 customers a day. Her main challenges are poultry diseases and thieves. Prossy works seven days a week and has been with MCDT for nine years, servicing her eighteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to having 800 birds.

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Muni's Group

texts.en:
Muni baji is the wife of M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 40 years. She is the mother of eight children: six sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a railway station. The next to him has a mobile shop. The others are also set in their own works. Muni baji’s daughters help her in household work. Muni baji’s husband has a pigeon selling business. He sells these at a famous market named “Tolinton Market”.

Muni baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more mobile phones to expand her son’s mobile phone business, so that he will be able to sell more mobile phones and earn profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tasneem baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones to resell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (switch boards, switches and tube lights) for her shop. Talat baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones to resell

loans.name: Hafiza's Group

texts.en:
Hafiza baji is the wife of M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 20 years. She completed her education until 8th standard. She couldn’t study further due to the poor conditions of her household, and her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is in 4th standard. Her elder daughter reads in kindergarten. The others are not of an age for going to school.

Hafiza baji’s husband has a shoe selling business. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Hafiza baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors, charging fees. She takes $3 to $4 per dress. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to buy more shoes for her husband’s shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaila baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Safia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rubina baji wants a loan to buy leather to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell

loans.name: Mahmadnabi

texts.ru:
Дурманов Махмаднаби, 1964 года рождения, имеет 4 иждивенцев. Начал свой бизнес с продажи риса. В этом бизнесе уже 7 лет. Сейчас у Махмаднаби широкий ассортимент бобовых культур, таких как рис, горох, соя, маш, кунджит, гречка. Рис является одним из основных продуктов в меню населения Таджикистана, из него готовят «плов». Также у него в продажи имеются разновидность растительного масла, которая необходима для приготовления этого чудного и колорийного блюда. Покупает свой товар у дехкан, с оптовых магазинов Сафар – Центра Шухрат продает товары народного потребления и продукты питания на дехканском рынке Гисара. 
Шухрату нужны средства для закупа риса и он хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Mahmadnabi D. was born in 1964 and has four dependents. He started his business by selling rice. He has been in this business for seven years. Now, Mahmadnabi carries a wide assortment of legumes, such as rice, peas, soy, mung beans, sesame seeds, and buckwheat. Rice is a dietary staple in Tajikistan; people make plov, a type of pilaf, from it. He also sells a variety of vegetable oils which are necessary to prepare this wonderful, high-calorie dish. He buys the goods from small farmers at the wholesale shop Safar in the Shuhrat region and sells the goods and food at a farmers’ market in Gissar. Mahmadnabi needs money to buy rice, so he wants to take out a loan for 3,500 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying rice

loans.name: Florence Nawire’S Group

texts.en:
Florence is a leader of a 5-member loan group.  

She is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children between 2 and 12 years of age. Three of her children go to school. Florence takes care of two additional family members. She rents a two-room house where she is staying with seven people. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home 

The family gets two meals a day; they occasionally take tea. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Florence uses public transport to get to and from shopping.

Florence brew a local beer in Kasubi, one of the city suburbs. She buys raw materials, like maize flour and millet, from Owino market in Kampala. She sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail. Florence receives 15-20 customers a day, depending on the weather. When it rains, few customers come in for a drink. 

Florence has been with MCDT for four years, is is now requesting her 12th loan. She wants to use this loan to boost her business and to open another branch taproom in Nakulabye.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar baji is the wife of A. R. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 40 years. Naseem baji is a mother of four sons. Her eldest son is involved in a movie-making business. He takes orders for different occasions (birthdays, weddings, etc). The next to him helps his elder brother in the business. The others are free and don’t do anything. Naseem baji’s husband has a food business. He sells food, particularly Punjabi food (Halwa poudi and Nan Chana), in his community. Naseem baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy another movie camera for her son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rakhshanda baji wants a loan to buy clothes and jewelry to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy fruit (dates) to resell. Lubna baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture business. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another movie camera

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez Fatima is the wife of M. B. and lives in an historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 6 years. She is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her elder son is a butcher by profession. The others are free and don’t do anything. Her daughters prefer to do household work. Kaneez Fatime Baji’s husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kaneez Baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy livestock (goats) for her son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food business. Imtiaz Baji and Ruqaiya Baji each wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Farzana Baji wants a loan to buy meat to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Nassazi Rachael’S Group

texts.en:
Rachael is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 30 years old and married with 5 children, aged between 15 and 3 years. All her children go to school. Rachael is a very hard-working lady, taking care of three orphans and her old mother. She resides in and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with six people. They don’t have electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala, and she uses public transport. Rachael deals in second hand clothes, selling them from Owino market, which is in Kampala city. She sells to all categories of people, both by wholesale and retail. Rachael receives 15-20 customers a day, depending on the weather: when it rains, few customers come in, because the area where she is staying is prone to floods. Rachael works seven days a week. Her main challenge is the rainy season. She has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her twelfth loan. She wants to use this loan to acquire more capital for her business.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Mohira Z. is married and has two small children.  When she realized that her husband needed help feeding and housing their family, she began selling men's clothes and shoes at a local market.  One each week, Mohira purchases goods from another city at wholesale prices and sells them at retail prices to her clients.  In order to increase her upfront purchases and turnover rate, Mohira is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.en: Bifotima Z. is divorced but still supports her two children.  Every day, she works in the local market selling groceries to her regular clients.  In order to increase her profit to put her children through school, Bifotima needs to expand her business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $600, which will be used to purchase a larger variety of groceries.

loans.use: Purchasing more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mr. Prak S. is a farmer in Samroung village in Takeo Province. He is single and he has a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Mr. Prack S. does not have enough money to pay his living expenses. Thus, he has decided to ask a loan to buy a cow. He hopes this loan will help him to increase his income and improve his living condition.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Pharn

texts.en: Mr. Pharn N. is 38 years old and makes a living selling oxen. Normally, he buys oxen from breeders and holds on to them for a while before selling them for a profit. He earns around 20000 Riel ($5) per day. He is married to Mrs. Prak Thun, 36, who has made a living for the past 18 years as a rice farmer and earns around 15,000 Riel ($3.75) per day. Pharn has two children, both of whom are very young and live at home. The family lives in Lveng Rusei Commune, Siem Reap Province. Currently, Pharn’s business is going well but he has applied for a loan to buy more oxen. He would also like to buy rice to resell when the price goes higher. Mr. Pharn's wife is pictured because he was not available when we took the photo.

loans.use: to buy oxen and rice for resale later

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat baji is the wife of M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five children: one son and four daughters. Her eldest daughter is in 3rd standard. Her son is in 2nd standard. The younger to him is in kindergarten. Her last two daughters are not of a school-going age.

Musarat baji’s husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Musarat baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to expand her shampoo selling business. Tahira baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy artificial flowers for her decoration business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: Komiljon M. is married and has two children.  As the chief of his family, Komiljon is responsible for feeding his wife and children, and therefore started a business selling men's clothes.  He purchases the goods from another city twice each week and resells them in the market near his house.  In order to purchase more goods and increase the number of clients attracted to his business, Komiljon is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To purchase more cloths for resale.

loans.name: Krong

texts.en: Mrs. Krong N., 34, is a farmer who also breeds ducks to sell their eggs. She earns approximately 15,000 Riel ($3.75) per day. She is married to Mr. Tha Pat, 59, who makes a living fishing in Tolesap Lake, the largest in Cambodia and one which contains lots of fish. Normally, Krong buys baby ducks from breeders and fattens them up for two or three months so that they can provide eggs. Her business is going well but she needs money to buy baby ducks and feed for them. She is applying for a loan to make these purchases.

loans.use: to purchase baby ducks and food for them to eat

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif P. has managed a transportation business with a minibus for many years.  Because he is recognized for being an experienced driver, he has many regular clients and earns a respectable income.  But increasing petrol prices have made it difficult for him to turn a profit.  Therefore, he has decided to convert his minibus to natural gas, which will save him money on fuel and allow him to offer his services for cheaper prices.  Latif is requesting a loan of $300, which will be used to purchase  a gas canister.

loans.use: To purchase gas canister for a minibus.

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en: Mrs. Thoem N. is a villager in On Doung Thmor village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhem Sak, are farmers and they do not earn enough money to make a good living. Thus, Mrs. Thoem N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy zinc to repair her house and she also wants to buy a cow to feed. She hopes to increase her family’s income. She is 32-years-old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other three children are too young. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy zinc to repair her house and to buy a cow

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira H. has one daughter and works as a hairstylist.  However, she is qualified to be teacher but found that she couldn't earn enough teaching high school students.  After taking lessons in hairstyling four years ago, she began renting a small stall and repaired the equipment herself.  Now she works with her daughter, who is also a talented hairstylist.  In order to purchase more sophisticated equipment and attract more customers, Nazira is requesting a loan of $800.

loans.use: To purchase hairstyling inventory.

loans.name: Chul

texts.en: Mrs. Phal C. is 29 years old and makes a living selling groceries in her village. She is married to Mr. Phal Cheng and has two children, both of whom live at home in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. To increase their income and better support their young family, Phal and her husband need a loan to buy a store where they will sell pork. They will also use the loan to buy pigs to sell. The loans will help them improve their business and their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a store to sell pork and pigs to sell

loans.name: Inom

texts.en: Inom B. is 46 years old and a father of four children.  For many years he has built doors and windows, which he sells either directly to clients or at the market near his home.  Because he always charges fair prices but builds high quality windows and doors, he has maintained a steady relationship with all of his clients.  One of Inom's greatest ambitions is to send his son to university.  Because university is so expensive, Inom is hoping to expand his business and thereby increase his profits.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1200, which will be used to purchase more materials for building finer windows and doors.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Kokadiè (La Sinsinrité). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe kokadiè est un regroupement de six femmes du   quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso.  Elles ont une moyenne d’âge 49 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 8 enfants.
Les membres mènent différentes activités (la vente d’habits de chaussures et de parures.) et sont des clientes de longue date de Soro Yiriwaso et cela depuis 6 ans.
Le prêt actuel de 100.000 FCFA par membre sera utilisé pour constituer des stocks importants d’habits et des parures pour les fêtes de Tabaski et de fin d’année.
Les achats se font à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes du marché principal et les ventes au marché de Koutiala à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes.
Elles espèrent sur un bénéfice de 80 000 CFA. de bénéfice. En dehors du remboursement des prêts elles utiliseront une partie de leur revenu pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kokadiè is a group of six women of the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). They average 49 years of age, are married, and are mothers of at least eight children. The members do different work (selling clothing, shoes, and finery) have been long-time clients of Soro Yirowaso for six years.

The current loan of 100,000 francs CFA for each member will be used to build up a sizable inventory of clothing and jewelry and other finery for the holiday of Tabaski and for year-end holidays. The purchases are made in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers of the main marketplace. Sales are made at the Koutiala marketplace to customers composed essentially of women.

They are hoping for a profit of 80,000 francs CFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a portion of their income to address typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and finery

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Mr. Ty M. is a 38-year-old widower who works in construction and also raises poultry. He earns around 8000 Riel a day and cares for his three children, all of whom are in school. The family lives in Veal Commune, Pursat Province. He needs a loan of $125 to buy more poultry to raise for sale.

loans.use: to buy more poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom R., 34, is a rice farmer who also raises pigs for a living. She is widowed with two children, both of whom are in secondary school, and lives in Veal Commune, Pursat Province. To increase her family’s income, she would like to request a $350 loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira T. is married and has four children.  Together with her husband, she makes bread in her house and sells it at the local market.  Because they use good ingredients, their bread has become very popular in their region and they have many cients.  But the increasing price of flour and other ingredients has made it difficult for them to market their bread at prices that satisfy their customers.  Therefore, Munira is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: Purchasing flour and other bread ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Panama (Nom D’Une Personne Honoré De Leur Village) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe P. est un regroupement de 6 femmes âgées de 40 ans en moyenne, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants vivant dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)

Les membres du groupe P. sont des spécialistes de la teinture d’habits. Très sollicitées pour la qualité de leur production, elles reçoivent des commandes importantes d’une clientèle de plus en plus importante. Pour faire face à cette demande importante elles décidèrent de rejoindre le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 150.000 FCFA pour le cinquième prêt. En plus de cette principale activité, elles mènent d’autres activités comme la vente d’encens (déodorant naturel apprécié pour l’odeur de sa fumée) et de henné (plante dont les feuilles permettent de noircir les pieds et les mains). Elles s’approvisionnent en bazin (tissus blancs très appréciés en Afrique de l’ouest) à Bamako en achat groupé pour les teindre en motifs et couleurs différentes sur place à Kimparana. Les produits finis sont vendus sur place à Kimparana et à Koutiala à une clientèle variée. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 180 000FCFA tout le long du prêt qui servira à faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The P. group is an association of six (6) women, whose average age is 40 years. They are married and each are mothers to five (5) or more children. They live in the village of Kimparana, a prefecture in the San region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members of the P. group are specialists in dying clothing. Their high quality products are in much demand and they have been receiving major orders from an ever growing clientele. To meet this growing demand they decided to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso (microbank) two years ago.The amounts of their loans has gone from a first loan of 50,000 francs CFA to their fifth loan of 150,000 francs CFA.

Besides their principle business, they manage other activities such as the sale of incense (natural scents known for their odour and smoke) and "henné" (plant leaves that darken the hands and feet). They buy "bazin" ( a white cloth, popular in West Africa) in the city of Bamako as a group purchase, then dye the product to various designs and colors (to customer request) in Kimparana. The finished products are sold in Kimparana and Koutiala to a wide range of clientele. They each expect to earn a profit of 180,000 francs CFA over the life of the loan which will be used to meet ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "bezin" (white cloth) for dyeing

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa M. is married and has ten children.  In order to help her husband support their family, she sells vegetables in the local market, which she purchases from other markets around their home early every morning.  Her children, when they are not in school, try to help her but even then it is difficult for them to market the produce without a proper shop.  Therefore, Hanifa is requesting a loan of $1200, which will allow her to purchase a permanent booth in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a permanent booth at the market.

loans.name: Sewa (Joy) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sewa est un regroupement de cinq femmes qui sont des voisines dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants. 

Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 100.000 FCFA pour le troisième prêt. Elles mènent différentes activités comme la vente des ustensiles de cuisine, des habits et des produits divers.
